cm7ZDI2su48ev2UCTGV7bg.text: Excellent. Best salad I ever had. It's called the Summer Salad. It has shrimp and mango salsa. They also have steamed dumplings as an appetizer. Great food.

lcDxzWPwW9g-BcSESuvYjQ.text: Met friends here to catch up.  Was quickly seated on a weeknight.  Parked in the local garage, which was a 1/2 block away.  Immediately asked about drinks, then left alone for a very long time.  When the rest of my party arrived, we ordered. I had the half-off (happy hour) jalapeno popper dip with pita and chips.  The dip was good (jalapenos, cream cheese, breading topping), but very salty (and I love salt), as where the chips.  I couldn't finish it because of that, and probably downed about 2-3 glasses of water. I ordered a chicken sandwich with bacon, cheese, and apple (I can't recall the name).  My chicken was cold and a bit pink in the middle. I pulled it off and ate the rest, which was also super salty from the bacon. I did enjoy the sweet potato tots, which were crisp on the outside and hot on the inside. After 2 more glasses of water from the bacon saltiness, I had to find the restrooms.  The bathrooms were upstairs, and we had to weave between tightly packed people both downstairs and upstairs to get there.  All-in-all, this place was OK, I'd be willing to visit again, as I spent about $20 total for my over-salted food.

_qCxoqEoKWdqWj1Dxnrcog.text: Great selection and good food/service. Nice selection and the happy hour draft list looked great as well.

hXEHrCtH8NPjjsG9XQ2yDw.text: The soup was watery and the drink was weak. The cocktails here are not worth the money for such a weak pour.

yubHunaJy-clfaI3yOSmtQ.text: Three of my favorite things about Shady Grove: wine night on Wednesdays, their delicious sweet potato tater tots, and the salads served in mixing bowls.  I love meeting friends for lunch here because I love their salad choices. The Cobb is my favorite, but I really like the Southwest as well, and the strawberry salad in the summer.  I love sitting outside during spring, summer, or fall. It's quite lovely to be close to the hustle and bustle of Shadyside, but not too close.

wqAqM3PLB-3t4BOrU4q8pw.text: Easy to get to (bus stop is less than a block away), good hearty food with a modern twist. A bit on the pricey side, but still good value. The Shady Grove Burger is a must! It gets really busy though so plan to wait a bit on Friday or Saturday evenings... The venue upstairs is nice and comfortable if you plan on hosting a larger group. They come highly recommended! :-)

TCRfOyqkQT9KeIggSolTlw.text: The Swiss bacon melt cheese burger was really good! Cooked to my liking. Atmosphere was really nice as well.

nLU8Ld4lTr82clpB3kMBEw.text: You had me at tater tots, but then you had to one up that and make them out of sweet potatoes.  I think I may love you now.  You have filled a void I didn't even know I had.  We arrived during a lunch time rush but were seated immediately and we didn't have to wait a minute for the waitress to come over.  With our drink orders placed we decided to read over the menu and then make our selections.  We started with the Shady Sticks and were happy with those.  All they are is a pizza with the sauce on the side for dipping.  I mean it's like a medium sized pizza, so a very good portion and the dough was so sweet and mixed with the three types of cheese on it was great.  For my main course I opted for the California BLT.  When I ordered this I was assuming that it was going to be run of the mill, thrown together BLT.  Was I ever surprised.  Multigrain bread topped with applewood bacon, crispy lettuce and thickly sliced tomatoes.  I was most surprised by the tomatoes, I was expecting uniformly cut and small.  What I got was like someone took a tomato from a basket, cut it quickly and didn't care how it looked, I approve!  Now, back to those tater tots!  I am completely infatuated with them.  They were crunchy and puffy and so delightful.  Just the right size to pop in your mouth and munch away.  Their side of Cajun ranch is an amazing compliment.  I was as near to heaven as I could be with those, no joke.  I also opted for the blackberry mojito.  Best way to describe it is by saying it was bittersweet.  The mint played off of the blackberry and it played well.  Seating was nice, at a high table, we were at the corner that we could not only people watch inside the restaurant, but we could also people watch on the sidewalk.  Televisions on, music blaring, people singing, it was a great atmosphere.

vN5z4s25U-yi_7tf9AdAGA.text: I have been going to Shadygrove for half off burgers almost every Monday, it's a great deal! Burgers usually come out to around $5 and drafts are around $3. I've had the Shady Grove Burger about 5 times. Quality is a bit inconsistent (can be overcooked sometimes) but is still delicious. Also this place has the best fries I have ever had - crispy outside and soft inside. Only once were the fries done badly (fried in old oil). Wednesday wine night is also fun and has great music! A lot of 90s hip hop. It does get very loud in the upstairs area, so don't expect to have any intimate conversations. They do get busy, so be prepared to wait a bit. Also, skip the tacos, blech. :P

yRpPjmTr_iJaO4bBhTV5Fg.text: I've been here a few times now and I have received great service each time. The food is great! Can't go wrong with anything on the menu. The wait times for a table can be a bit much, but by using NoWait you can hop into line and still do other stuff around Shadyside.

n_kaJGoucOCI9v0E03afBA.text: This is a decent place to go for happy hour and I like the happy hour themes they have each day of the week.  My friends and I went for the Wednesday half off wine night and enjoyed a nice bottle of wine for cheap.  I also tried several of the appetizers and they were all tasty, good sized portions, and reasonably priced.  Nothing amazing, but all good.  Despite the place being packed the food came out quickly and the server was pretty attentive given how busy the place was.

cg_K0UAIs6H_U5sxHpJmAw.text: Had the yak burger (excluded from the half-price burger offer on Mondays), and it was just okay - certainly not worth the $11 I'd paid for it.  The stuffed pepper soup was tasty and original, however, and the dinner salad was also decent.  Overall Shady Grove is respectable enough as a casual dining option, but there's nothing about it that would compel a return trip.

hvXh4RUqmxesn1qJmPdSwA.text: The only reason I'm giving this spot 4 stars is because of the spacing. There's outdoor seating too, but I wish there was a little more room inside the building. The food is great, the atmosphere is great, the specials are great, the selection is great, the prices are great. This is one of those rare places in Pittsburgh that is consistently a wonderful experience.

zaD7yD2yFTMHaiqdqPuc6w.text: Found this place by accident.  Random guy walking down the street recommended 2-3 places to eat.  Great hole in the wall kind of feel.  Great place for a quick lunch!  Had the Pulled BBQ sandwich and fries.  It was delicious and a large amount of food for the money.  I would recommend this restaurant to anyone passing through!

6qnEviz6mQitZLIPv7mXag.text: Amidst all that hipness of Shadyside, full of overpriced and not-so-good food, Shady Grove was a surprise. They have a great variety for well-served sandwiches and snacks, and the place is usually packed. Great to bring your date or group of friends. Service there was really good as well.

lr6NjUcXJ5n_dtmFxt4L-w.text: My fiance and I were visiting Pittsburgh and wanted to try a local place.  We were in Shadyside, so we decided on Shady Grove.  The place was PERFECT.  We had Sunday lunch, got a pizza -- had the most AMAZING dough (almost sweet) and we had teh fish taco's which were also phenomenal.  I was NOT feeling well BEFORE I ate here, and afterwards I felt like a million bucks.  Would definitely reccommend for a local, clean, fresh meal!   Oh -- I waitress Lauren was also SUPER nice!

f48quEu1l78C1eMMzsD04Q.text: Monday's burger nights (~$5) is the best deal I've found in the city for the cost. Comes with fries, and $4 Jim Bean drinks makes for a solid meal in an up-scale, but relaxed atmosphere. Wine nights on Wednesday are great too with 1/2 price bottles. The bar staff is consistent and always keep a good atmosphere.

AfoBV-smFoNS5iRfU9EbJg.text: Yeah for a great lunch spot!  The salads are awesome!  I love when a restaurant has unusual salad combinations, not the usual Cesar, house and grilled chicken.  Boring!  I tried the veggie salad, which sounds basic, but wasnt.  It was huge and filled with yummy greens, broccoli, grilled portobellas and sunflower seeds.  I didnt need dressing bc there were so many yummy things included!  There were also some other great salads with goat cheese, eggs, avocados.  YUM!  My mother in law got some delicious looking artichoke spin dip and my sister in law got the tuna tacos, which looked amazing!  So much to choose from, I will definitely be going back!

isWyQdF0NL2yKX22AqtYQg.text: Awesome thin crust pizza - Marguerita is my fav - also try the shrimp tacos! Good beers too. Some of the servers are a little Tri-Delt for my taste (one of the regular servers in particular has attitude to the max), but most are friendly. Also really good salads... I never say that :-)

DCtb_8dYGeVucX9fy8i5_Q.text: It's not that bad during their happy hours. The beer deals are pretty good. I tried the yak burger and it was "meh".  The place does get pretty crowded and hence sometimes seating might be an issue. Its just loud enough (so that you don't have to scream at each other) if you aren't in the very back section. The half price wine nights are pretty good too.

9mhN9cjPmpbPwcZep0hITQ.text: If you're looking for a salad, prepare yourself to eat the whole garden. These veggie bowls are huge.   I got the Pittsburgh salad complete with Waffle fries on my first visit. My second visit wasn't as healthy: Fried Green Tomatoes and the 'Shroom pizza. The tomatoes were spicey and super yummy, served on bed of mixed greens.   Bread means a lot to me, so when this pizza aced the bread test, I was in love. The $11 dollars I paid for a small was more than worth it. 8 large slices that could have easily filled the tummies of three or more people.   I also downed a couple of tequila sours with my meal. I have nothing but good things to say about every aspect of this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Shady Grove - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. &#39;Shroom Pizza
Photo of Shady Grove - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Fried green tomatoes.

7WkE_kp-i2o5MQUAOxf6Jw.text: I came here on a mildly busy Tuesday night. My server was VERY wonderful. My mom always asks questions about small trivial things on the menu or something written on the wall about the happy hour, but the server was very helpful and was patient with my mom...which I really appreciate. So much so that when the check came, I looked for the server's name to write a review. Aimee, I really appreciate your service and I wish more servers are as awesome as you are. Thank you!  The food was great, the atmosphere is nice, and the service is top notch. 10/10 would recommend this place.

3rOsVMqpvV1Bpn10zqBtsQ.text: Shady Grove is anything but a shady spot in Shadyside. On my recent visit to Pittsburgh, I found it actually to be a pretty decent bar and restaurant.  All weekend long my group attempted to make it to Shady Grove for a bit to eat. We got in too late the first night, the kitchen closed too early on Saturday, but finally we were able to get our fix on Sunday for lunch.  It was kind of perfect actually since they had their Sunday mimosa special. It was $3 for a regular mimosa, applemosa or cranmosa. We also snagged a table outside so got to enjoy some sunshine.   The second I looked at the menu, I knew I had to try the Goat Pizza. Of course I had to get in on the mimosa deal as well. I had one regular and one applemosa. I enjoyed the apple and champagne however think I might be a standard orange juice mimosa type of gal.   Although I'm from out of town and this was my first visit to Shady Grove, the Goat Pizza must have been designed with me in mind. It was made up of some of my favorite ingredients: roasted garlic oil, goat cheese, bacon and roasted red peppers. If it included pesto, I may have died of happiness. In any case it sounded a little better on paper. The goat cheese came out as crumbles versus a spread. The menu didn't specify but my dream pizza would have had a creamier goat cheese. I was also expecting the garlic to be a little more prominent on the pie. Don't get me wrong, it was still extremely enjoyable, but I'm just a little picky when it comes to my goat cheese dishes.   I also got to sample my friend's pierogie pizza which I thought was pretty neat conceptually. I envisioned a regular pizza topped with pierogies however the pizza was topped with the ingredients of a cheddar, onion and bacon pierogie. It was a starch overload but absolutely tasty. My husband went with the jerk grilled chicken fingers. While I didn't try the chicken, the jalapeno mango sauce and cilantro serrano sauce were perfect for dunking my pizza crust. I also got to try a few of my friend's sweet potato tots. I could have easily housed them if he hadn't almost done so already.   While I love to dine al fresco, Shady Grove is located on a fairly trafficked street off of Walnut. Unfortunately, one street at the intersection wasn't paved well so dirt kept flying up at us when cars drove by. That probably could be avoided by sitting closer to Walnut Street or by sitting inside.   Our server was friendly and knowledgeable about the menu. One of my friends asked what her favorite menu item was and she was able to naturally rattle off a few things she likes and what scenario she usually eats them. It's always a plus when a server enjoys the food from their restaurant and can easily talk to the menu.   So aside from desire for goat cheese perfection and a little flying dirt, Shady Grove made for a pretty good lunch.

photos.caption: Photo of Shady Grove - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Grilled jerk chicken appetizer with mango jalapeño and cilantro Serrano dressings
Photo of Shady Grove - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Pierogie pizza (small)
Photo of Shady Grove - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The goat pizza (small)

izdZclHLg8tKroLmL6mnNw.text: Monday night is burger night and the fries are out of this world! If you have never been here, I strongly recommend going on a Monday to have a great meal at a crazy low price!   I am more of a beer drinker myself but the man who tends bar is top notch; I would argue he is the best bartender in Shadyside. He makes fantastic drinks and is always doing cool bar tricks.   I'm not a huge fan of the menu and to be honest I only ever eat here on burger night because its such a great deal. The service is very hit or miss depending on who's waiting tables.   As for the weekends, Shady "Groove" is the spot to get your dance on. Go upstairs on a Saturday night and you'll find a bunch of people dancing in a judgement free zone. There's always good music bumping and the crowd is usually pretty tame, it's a great environment!   If you go next door to Mario's, you will soon find that many of the loyal patrons mistake the bar for fight-club. Stay safe, avoid drama, and check out Shady Grove for a fun night out.

UqFZEl9GVPAYyeuWYxi5pg.text: Stopped in for lunch after a trip to the bakery around the corner. The atmosphere was great, plenty of outdoor seating was available, however we chose to sit inside. Our waitress was friendly, but couldn't answer our questions regarding the menu, for example we the burgers quarter or half pound. I ordered mine medium rare, my friend medium. The order came very quickly. The burgers were both well done, not seasoned at all and not good. The fries were the highlight of the meal. Definately not a $12 burger. The waitress also only returned once to check if we wanted our bill.  I will never go back unless it is for drinks only.

VIUK_zhwMlmA4lbdmr4Jrw.text: Fun place for burgers (incredibly cheap if you luck into half-price night, which we did). We sat at the bar. Comfortable, fun.

photos.caption: Photo of Shady Grove - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The Loaded Latkes were amazing and the Mango Salsa was good too

TDHjcAFh8aScvYrjDSs3Qw.text: I love shady grove. I have great service here every time and I have never waited to be seated even when they are relatively busy. The portions are very large and consistently good. Highly recommend the sweet potato tater tots, or the pizza because the dough is fairly unique. Salads are also a favorite, and they have good specials! I believe Wednesday is half priced bottles of wine. There is something for everyone on their extensive menu, and it's also good for a date night. American food with a twist. I will be back again for sure!

photos.caption: Photo of Shady Grove - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

tG-hU2BIgJuOpMPMtSM1Ow.text: Visited Shady Grove on a Monday evening. My friend and I both had salads which were huge and very good - the Cobb and the Pittsburgh salad. The people next to us had nachos and an order of latkes - both of these also looked so yum! We weren't in the mood for drinks but their happy hour specials looked pretty good. Definitely worth a visit if you're in Shadyside.

photos.caption: Photo of Shady Grove - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. There is a Pittsburgh salad buried beneath that cheese, chicken, waffle fries.
Photo of Shady Grove - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Bloomfield pizza. Small is 6 decent size pieces, enough to share with an appetizer

2cFXt1zwZEo0LGWJxOueBg.text: Came here with a friend for their half-off burgers promo. The place was pretty crowded, even on a Monday night so that says something! That being said, it's probably not the best place to come for a first date or to hold a meeting over a meal because it can get pretty loud. We didn't want to wait for a table, so we opted for the bar instead.   We got the guacamole deviled eggs as our appetizer and the Shady burger. The deviled eggs came with bacon pieces and tomatoes so it's not just fully guac which was a good thing. The burger was fine, just like any other decent burger. I wasn't a fan of the fries it came with. If you prefer thin fries instead of the thick ones, you might not enjoy the huge portion of fries they serve.   Overall, friendly staff, good food, and interesting promos every day. Shady grove is a decent choice if you're looking for traditional American food.

photos.caption: Photo of Shady Grove - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Guacamole deviled eggs
Photo of Shady Grove - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Shady burger

-2Y0NgSmVSPqMajMi9wnhQ.text: Shady Grove is one of my favorite lunch or dinner spots in Shadyside. The menu offers lots of different options from appetizers, fresh salads, and mouth watering sandwiches and wraps all for an affordable price. (I highly recommend trying the Harvest Chicken or the Pierogi Sandwich for first timers.) I'm currently working on trying everything on the menu once, and so far no dish has disappointed me. From a friendly owner, great service, fun daily specials, and an amazing wine night every Wednesday (1/2 off bottles of wine until midnight) complete with an upbeat DJ upstairs, Shady Grove has become a regular visit for me and my friends.  Keep it up Shady Grove!

p6Uvq-cW1eKD-STvgFOtLA.text: I always enjoy going here. They have such a variety of foods on their menu, such as appetizers, sandwiches and wraps, salads, pizzas, etc.  Everything that I have had has been yummy. Last week we had dinner there and I had the BBQ chicken salad. Salads come in large stainless bowls and dressing is always on the side. It was wonderful! Even though it was large, I ate every bite. Today I had a Korean fried chicken sandwich. It had pickles and pickled onions. It is new on the menu and very good. Good food, good prices, extensive menu

YDol1k6GIa6C84ojbd8xnw.text: Had the Prime Rib Salad with a maple cider vinaigrette!!!!!! WOWZA!!!!! It was great along with the prices and service

6a4Y1iptQo0X-LldsShGCg.text: I've had mixed experiences here but my recent visit was spectacular. They have a draft list with something for everyone and great daily specials as well as happy hour specials. There is more space than what it looks like too! It's a great place for a get together and they have so many options on their menu and large portion sizes.

zXKriYcX3xNxqblexMsb8A.text: Let me tell you a story. It was move in day at the university. I was all finished up with unpacking and we headed out to cheak into my dads hotel. After that, we picked up the cuz to go find some quality grub. we consulted the yelpers and found this spankin' resturaunt. The wait was very short for 6:00. apparently we got lucky. we looked at our menus and were absolutely horrified. how in god's butthole were we supposed to pick. everything looked and sounded pristine. Ya know when your waiter(tress) asked if you need a minute? she asked like 4 times. we needed a solid 20. i finally decided on the fried tomato blt after a waitress reccomendation. we also had the jerk fingers, guac deviled eggs, korean chicken, and pesto pizza. when i bit into my sandwhich i saw the face of god. he looked at me and winked. he was giving me me the "ya done good"-look. moral of the story, eat here. the end.

WUEdJLKphZwqBarQ4jsDjA.text: I looooove this place's pizza. The crust is unlike any I've had before, and the Buffalo chicken pizza might be my favorite pizza I've ever had. I haven't ordered anything from the menu that wasn't incredible. Price is a little high but the flavor is incomparable.

gtJouanvDfi0hS8j0Cv7gw.text: This place is great. We specifically chose this place so we could bring our small dog and eat on the patio. After we ordered it started raining, so our waitress made our orders to go. Then it stopped raining right before our orders were done, so she helped us wipe down the table and chairs so we could stay and enjoy the meal with our pup. So here's a shoutout to Olivia, the kindest and most accommodating waitress I've ever had! :)

photos.caption: Photo of Shady Grove - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Tucker enjoyed his time here!

d_kK6quwhZbAEqoKPGJitw.text: Haven't eaten here in almost six years and the food was still amazing!!!!! Today I got the steak burger med rare on a ciabatta bun  The service was great and very calm for lunch time because I know how busy they can get

KMXQ__MHIw6B-JR3Yj1f6A.text: Gotta love Shady Grove. Bellefonte, two story bar with an extension in the making. Downstairs is more casual and sports bar like, the upstairs is cocktail bar  classy. Additionally there is outdoor seating, perfect for warm summer and cool fall days.   The menu is standard wraps and salad, a few appetizers and great bars. Wednesday and Friday is their half-off bottle of wine specials, Wednesday, Friday and soon to be Saturday they have a DJ spinning to make this location the only dance floor in Shadyside.   Always a favorite. Come soon, come often

3afs6f7Lhs0QGm9nR63TfQ.text: Food is good but nothing too special. Nice happy hour prices and drink selection. This is my go to place in Shadyside. It has a wide menu, so something for everyone. The pizza has a sweet crust, which I don't personally enjoy, but others love! The salads are huge! Overall, pretty good!

0mVRVJMq6S9UfnHe1QJFrw.text: This is a nice place to go to drink or eat. The food is alright but the atmosphere is better. Monday's are half priced burgers which is a pretty good deal to go to but the service is hit or miss. Sometimes it's great sometimes it's terrible, but it hasn't stopped me from going back again and again.   Update - their brunch menu is like a joke because half the items are available on the regular menu and just have eggs on them always. $4 mimosas on Sunday but other than that would not recommend as a brunch spot.

uS-FRtBw6SJVrlAcWvC0sA.text: Good low-key bar just off of Walnut, but the food is greasy as all get out. Go here for a beer with friends, but not for dinner. They have some outside alley/sidewalk seating in the summer which can be nice.

YR2jybmqzXpMMNJM62e4Tg.text: The staff here are friendly and excellent.  They were very accommodating to our party of 4 with 2 babies.  Their food was average pub fare and priced fairly.  I would return in a pinch.

Kw6kVMogIaTSs1hyRtyjcw.text: Service isn't great, but the food is above average and the atmosphere is welcoming. I like the sweet potato tots. Wednesday night is half off bottles of wine, but it gets packed.

LzjHUhlaaASjUFQwt_UgqQ.text: Although our waitress was very nice and paid attention to our drink levels the whole time, the service overall was slow, and it was not busy at all.  I'd hate to see this place at a prime time.  The spaces to sit outside were super cramped and you almost have to sit on top of the next table.  The food was pretty mediocre.  It was certainly nothing to write home about.  I would not go out of my way to eat there again.

b4iqJ0re9OUuGVIwEoxyow.text: This dining experience was lousy(company excluded), and a reminder to me that I should always trust my sushi instincts.  If Shady Grove is the best that  Walnut Street has to offer as far as drinking and dining, then it's no wonder that Shadyside needs a boost of steroids.  Perhaps, Barry shouldn't have been so quick to leave the Burgh or he should have left some of his good stuff behind.  My friend and I decided to order some of their artisan pizzas, and the Margharita and the Pesto were our choices.  The  honey wheat dough tasted like it came directly from the nearest Taco Bell caramel apple empenada assembly line.  The mutilated tomato bits strewn across each of the pizzas also must have come from a Taco Bell assembly line. Most of the items that should have been on the pizza were MIA.  When I asked our server about it, her expression was as empty as the street outside, which i thought would be jam packed with shoppers considering it was the Sidewalk Sale Event.

bjSZnRL0cRzc-tiOTf_Kyw.text: Some friends and I stopped here so we could sit outside, have a couple drinks, and relax.  This place met those needs.  We didn't try any of the food, beyond the fruit cup that my friend had and enjoyed.  The drinks were well made, the service was okay, and the seating was fine.  I'd go back to try the food, but nothing to go out of the way for.

2inUEIaz7aLQ6HqsaOEa9g.text: Great little dive, but trendy... Came to a local hospital to visit a friend and the misses needed to do a little shopping on walnut street. Stumbled across this little gem. My "Shady" burger was excellent. My wife's "Capris" sandwich was also excellent. Servers and bartenders were very attentive and busy... loved the local feel... we decided to eat at the bar and wasn't disappointed at all... place was clean... all the staff was friendly and competent, which is rare now a days. Enjoy

Photo of Shady Grove - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Shady Burger. Very good.
Photo of Shady Grove - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Caprice sandwich. Added chicken.

jrHBsg_34aWvLjx0YTp-HA.text: Not a good first experience at all. I walked in on a slow Friday afternoon. I was not greeted by ANYONE at all upon entering (mind you there was bartenders standing around idle) and no one spoke to me. Next, I sat there for a good 5 minutes which felt like 10, and had to ask a bartender for a menu to even get any sort of service. Anywho, the bartender wasn't too thrilled to serve me for whatever reason. For my first visit I'd rate customer service a solid 1 star.  Next, the food. I ordered my food which was not good at all. I had a half cooked buffalo chicken pizza. It was not thoroughly cooked at all. My stomach was in utter pain after consuming one slice! The dough was not thoroughly cooked and nor was the cheese. I wasn't impressed. I will not return here. I only recommend this place for a quick fast food option or somewhere to go on a drunk Saturday night.. nothing else!

s3Hq2cj_42QN9PEJ-URZ1g.text: The main draw for me to the shady grove is during the summer when you can sit on their patio on a side street just right off of Walnut street. When the weather is nice, we've enjoyed a few nights out there drinking a half priced bottle of wine on Wednesdays.   We recently went to watch a football game inside and it was enjoyable because it wasn't crowded at all and we got a high top table in the corner where we could hang out and talk for a few hours. The inside is not very big and the bar goes down the middle of the restaurant. The food is okay, however we never think to go there for dinner when we are considering options. They do have a pretty large menu and this past time we ordered the spinach and artichoke dip, and nachos and liked both.   I'd recommend this place if you're looking for a laid back place and some straight forward American food.

photos.caption: Photo of Shady Grove - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Weekly specials

qawoM3P4uuAeq_QdvF6eKA.text: Great spot with a wide selection of food for everyone. One of the very few spots to get shishito peppers and they come with an AMAZING sauce! Food comes out quick and service is fast. Atmosphere is vibey and young. Only issue that would make this a 4.5 is the drink prices can be a little steep, but I still round this out to a 5/5

KImyGr1cQQpTMPvlD-7lLg.text: This place is awesome. It's a tiny bar/restaurant tucked off the main drag in Shadyside with great food and drinks and daily specials. It is not a larger establishment by any means so if you have a big party , i'd suggest elsewhere.   We started out with the chicken nachos as an appetizer- they were huge, and delicious. Very good chili on them.   My wife ordered the BBQ chicken pizza which she loved, I tried a small bite as I don't like onions but it was good- the crust is sweet, it has a distinct taste to it.   I ordered the Shady Steak in wrap form and was blown away. It comes with potato latkes, egg, and garlic aioli and it was phenomenal, highly recommend.   Service was really good as well. Aside from being a little crammed in and having to go upstairs for the bathroom, this place is a must visit

AOL83vgT7110gXmZ3yv0ug.text: We stopped in this evening for a light snack and a few drinks after a show at the University of Pittsburgh.  All was fine until a girl at the bar left her purse when she left and my friend tried to run out and stop her.  I followed him out to see if I could help and was holding the door open for a moment that lead outside.  Once I realized that he may have reached her or attempted to keep looked I turned around to go back in and the "Bouncer" who was sitting near the main door to the restaurant screams at me to close the door because he was cold and rolls his eyes at me. So I turned to him and said "I'm sorry but we live in PA so learn to deal with the cold and as a paying customer maybe you can back off." And I made my way back up to the bar.  When I told the bartenders of the attitude and what he said they laughed.  At that point I was done and was actually thinking of refusing to pay my bill or tip.  Then some slutty waitress was wearing a shirt that was showing the majority of her braw and unflattering side boob.  Overall, stay away unless you want some average food, ignorant staff to deal with and a bouncer who should never be the first impression of any business to treat you like garbage

oCrlNJrbvZe7P_y58vvPmg.text: I have never felt the desire to try Shady Grove based on the reviews, but I ended up coming here last week.  Apparently, Wednesday nights are half price wine bottle nights, but I just wanted food.  The happy hour chicken nachos ($6) were a good start for a group of four.  The portion was large and the nachos were pretty loaded.  However, I ordered a buffalo chicken wrap ($10).  I didn't enjoy it, as it was mostly just drenched in hot sauce.  I took half of it home and threw the untouched wrap away a week later.  My friends were equally unimpressed with the quality and the price.  I really have no desire to come back here, but I would at least consider ordering appetizers off of the happy hour menu.  Service was mediocre.  Otherwise, fairly unimpressed.

photos.caption: Photo of Shady Grove - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Happy Hour Chicken Nachos ... $6

c-S5Z8gPlXIoiCTmSgQ4wg.text: Amazing food, awesome sized portions, and great customer service. I would definitely recommend this spot!! From out of town, and it was probably the best place I ate all weekend.

iN6kMPcboR-RdSxYdrpZOw.text: Awesome food and drinks! Best think had to be the Capri sun because i felt like a kid just with an adult beverage. The servers were excellent. Left full and happy

photos.caption: Photo of Shady Grove - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

Dy6bekifqFbX78kuQrfmXg.text: For some reason, this place is always busy. I go here when I'm too tired to think of a place but still want to feel like I had lunch/dinner 'outside'. Large portions as is the norm, nice selection of drinks. I have tried a few burgers/sandwiches here (huge!).

4bupLLkeeK3J1nhPvrPbLw.text: Had a great burger and beer here. Oh and the loaded latkes, best appetizer. Busy lively place with great choices for everyone.

photos.caption: Photo of Shady Grove - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. A porter and a witbeer at Shady Geove

nxNkV240LP-nQ3oC29FN3g.text: Can you believe I've never been here before?! Crazy, right? Great first experience too!  Our server was the friendliest ever, so that was just the start. I ordered the Veggie Explosion salad and am happy to report it was exactly as advertised! I hate when you get a salad and the toppings are sparse. There were loads of veggies and I especially liked the grilled portobella mushrooms. I thought the balsamic dressing made it a winning combo.  I also ordered the tomato soup, which I believe is always on the menu. It was excellent. I love a nice creamy tomato, and it was just that. I was pleasantly surprised by what a nice lunch it was!

photos.caption: Photo of Shady Grove - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Power Veggie Salad

Ptj0_DYNoxAXYY7LqXFXFA.text: Guys, this place will never leave your mind after coming here. I have only been here once, but it was just so comforting and memorable! First off, their fries are incredible - like some good ol' pub fries! So obviously a very important aspect. The prices aren't bad AT ALL in my opinion. The menu is different, but with familiar food! That's the best way I can explain it. I got the chicken Caesar wrap when I went (with fries, duh) and it was such a large portion and so delicious! I've been dying to stop here for brunch, or just really any other time, but I'm not super close by. Again, I've been here one time, but I can't stop thinking about how good it was!

_2i5PzGWIlVReU2pwmEj8w.text: Great Wednesday wine night but otherwise service is not great. Today was a slow day but they wouldn't let my group combine tables to accommodate our large group. Happy hour prices are good and wines are half off which makes it great. Outside seating is nice in the warm weather though so I'll be returning.

Ec58sSH7cICkKRvE2MRZYA.text: My girlfriend and I ended up here on 'Date Night' - This was a date night a few weeks ago, so although the food was pretty good I don't remember what we had. It wasn't anything spectacular but we enjoyed. Decor is nice, the place is massive and our waitress was friendly. Just be careful! - Wines were on special that night and I somehow chose one that wasn't and it was like $13 a glass and the waitress didn't warn me or anything. I had two, my lady had 1, so between that and our food we spent close to $100. Didn't plan on it.

xtOlvrptGEv5FyNONM3lrw.text: I've visited Shady Grove a few times over the past few years and always have a pleasant experience! This weekend I went with a group of my girlfriends for my friends birthday. It was a Friday night and we had to wait about 30 minutes to get seated, which was fine with us since we were able to find seats at the bar while we waited! It was very busy but the bartender served us right away. I started with a cosmo, which was great! My other 2 friends had dirty martinis and they said theirs were great as well.   We were seated after about 30-40 minutes of waiting and we had a great table for the 6 of us! Our waitress was nice but you could tell she was very busy and rushing around. We started with the hummus, I order every time I go! They give a lot of hummus compared to the pita they give you, so we always ask for extra pita. For my entree I got the summer salad which is one of my favorites! It has shrimp, goat cheese, mango salsa, and sunflower seeds. Others around the table got ahi tuna, Cobb salad, and wraps. Shady Grove is a great place to visit while in Shady Side for a meal that will always be yummy!

u0hdb-vAEsit_cTvRdp6vw.text: Being a Philly girl, living in Western Pa, has been difficult, but Shady Grove and their yummy menu has made life her bearable!!! The food, the service, the atmosphere....all top notch!

W5rdqbTpMaz0gFMczmX3NA.text: I haven't been here in a while for 3 years approximately, and I am in awe due to the great service I received at the bar by Stan and Greg. Wow experience for sure, they hustle, to make you smile and make sure you're taken care of. Overall I will be back now. If you're looking for a good drink and good friendly serve get HERE! -Kri

8P5gEbSwGYay6EcHtw4gUw.text: I stopped here for some drinks for a friend's going away celebration. I didn't order food so this review is only for the bar service. If you're a rookie like I was, the address indicates that it's on Walnut but the entrance is actually on a street off of Walnut. Bellefonte Street to be exact. And when you enter the first door, you have two options: go through the door immediately to the right or go upstairs to the left. Apparently the upstairs bar becomes quite the party with a live DJ on the weekends.   My large party celebrated in the upstairs bar. You can also get food upstairs but note that the kitchen closes at 10 pm. Shady Grove does not take dinner reservations so our large group was scattered at different tables, as there weren't enough tables to fill us all. I opted to sit at the bar and got to see and hear the wait staff and bartenders interacting with each other. I can understand the frustrations of serving such a huge group, but I didn't really appreciate the permanent scowls on the employees' faces. I also didn't quite appreciate the tone they used when talking about our party to each other. Maybe they forgot I wasn't a part of that party but these kinds of conversations shouldn't be held in front of any customer.   All in all, I wasn't a huge fan. The service kind of turned me off from anything else it might have going for itself. It's unlikely I'll come back for drinks and possibly never for the food either.

7pcXo4V4-ZHVwC-meXan0g.text: Generous portions, popular place, flavorful entrees, good wait staff, something on the menu for everyone

photos.caption: Photo of Shady Grove - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Generous portions, popular place, flavorful entrees, good wait staff, something on the menu for everyone
Photo of Shady Grove - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Generous portions, popular place, flavorful entrees, good wait staff, something on the menu for everyone

CM17IMxpMjMQHZr63xQibQ.text: This place exceeded my expectations food-wise. I got the turkey burger and switched the fries for a side salad ($2 extra). Most places are stingy with the side salads, so I wasn't expecting much, but the waitress brought me a plate where the lettuce was practically overtaking the already large burger. Needless to say, it was a wise substitution. Even better, we went during happy hour (Monday's 5-10) so burgers were half off. For all you broke college kids, that's $5 a burger.   On the downside, they must compensate for happy hour by staffing the least charming waitresses on Monday nights. The girl serving us did everything right, but it was clear she was doing it out of obligation. I don't know if this bothers everyone, but it made dinner a little uncomfortable.

cl29uJi3zNR4dOVo-Ms-GA.text: Nice place to grab a cocktail in Shadyside. Great happy hours.

qHDWy5wE24wCxRVeq8398Q.text: Arrived here for happy hour on a Tuesday. Specials - $3 drafts, $4 wines, and $6 mojitos from 5 to 7 pm.   We ordered a few appetizers to share: chicken nachos ($11), mango salsa ($4) and grilled jerk shrimp ($5). The food was pretty good and a decent size. I especially loved the fresh jalapenos on the nachos and the convenience of the separate side cups of pico de gallo, sour cream and guacamole. The waitress was attentive and the noise level wasn't too bad. Unfortunately, my mojito was disappointing - very weak and fairly tasteless.   Shady Grove is a good choice for a casual night out at a decent price. I'll be back to test out wine night - you can never go wrong with half price bottles (Wednesday and Friday).

jmXAfHXQt7JXoNalH-Qdyw.text: Never had a bad meal at this place. The service is great and the food is always right. I've been to a few places around town that can screw up an order pretty easily, don't offer customization on items and the price doesn't match the quality; but this joint does not fall under any of those categories. Also, their To-Go section is on point. Highly recommend the sweet potato tots with their ranch dressing. It's fire.

oWJhptv35iIPvckEv4KSug.text: Grabbed take out lunch this afternoon around 1pm and had awesome and quick service. My husband got the shady steak wrap, which was full of flavor and better than expected, with waffle fries. It's a cheesesteak and egg wrap. I got the chick Caesar wrap with fries, which was also great. I love their fries and ranch dressing. The mimosas and soup that a lot of people had on their tables looked delicious :) love this spot when we are visiting Shadyside. The atmosphere is comfortable and fun and the food has always been great!

f6XULwfYz2cw2vpJqABkkg.text: I hadn't been to Shady Grove in a while but was craving a salad from there this past weekend so decided to check it out again. I was very impressed with the quick, quality service. I was sat outdoors (my preferred seating arrangement) almost immediately and greeted by my waitress moments later. I wasn't in a rush but I also didn't want to spend all day there and my whole dining experience lasted about 30 minutes. I was so happy.  I ordered their BBQ Chicken Salad w/ Ranch Dressing, which I've had before and was craving. It was just as good as I remember and I ate almost all of it. I don't have any complaints :)

x_fiAhkWZ923Gkt2qMcjbg.text: Came here with a couple of friends last Dec.  We had the waffle fries with cheese and bacon and something else to munch on (I don't remember what the other food item we ordered was), and the food was okay.  For drinks, we opted for cocktails.  My friends both ordered caramel appletinis, and really enjoyed them.  My drink, on the other hand, was just weird tasting.  I don't remember what it was supposed to be (they don't have a drink menu on the website; otherwise I could probably figure it out), but I remember it just tasted off, to the point that I couldn't finish it (and that *never* happens with me with cocktails).  My friends both tasted it and agreed.  Service was on the slow side, but then again, it was happy hour, and they were understaffed.  It seemed like a fun spot to have a few drinks after work--the crowd seemed to be mostly young professionals--and they have a decent variety of food to choose from.  I wanted to like this place, and I'd go back and give it another try, but I was underwhelmed on my first visit.  2.5 stars.

bKGeWv_OMnMvqoUbKZg5Xg.text: Shady Grove is a nice location, and I've been here on multiple occasions, mostly for their half off wine night on Wednesdays and Fridays. It can get pretty busy in here on those nights, and its generally a good place to meet people. I've had the food too a few times, and the menu is not bad - typical American fare. I've had mixed experiences with the service at the bar though. The doorman is a really great guy, and over my multiple trips had a very friendly acquaintance with him. Upstairs though, depending on the bartender, I've sometimes had the feeling of being deliberately ignored, while someone else just cleans the glasses. This is not the case always by any means, but it left me with a bad impression for some time. Its never happened downstairs though, and typically most of the staff is OK. In general though, its one of the fun places to go on Walnut Street.

G3lDx0nSqI7N4P7cwy5S4Q.text: I stop here for a glass of wine or beer when I'm leaving Journeys across the street. Nice outdoor seating. Service has always been good.   Food is okay. Not bad, not great, just okay. The hummus is good, but needs more pita for what is served. We asked for more pita and they upcharged us 50 cents...which is fine, but just add 50 cents to the price and give me more pita to start.   I've had other appetizers and salads here, but nothing memorable. I wish that it was because I do like the atmosphere and outdoor seating, but it just doesn't leave an impression.

0oMxnl6lLxXnFYMDbiiarw.text: Awesome sandwiches and pizza! The pizza had a sweet crust, which is unique. We had the Aglio pizza, highly recommend. If you favor good quality bread and dough this is the place.

WkP228q5txkPOr9L5PcAUw.text: Was not too bad for a bar type atmosphere.  I tried the deviled eggs. Delicious. Also tried the chipotle style pizza and it was pretty good. I'd recommend the place for some American style food for before or after a night out. Staff was really friendly and accommodating.

z719Q1Q0FZDb_ayKUqtsLg.text: Been here a few times now and while it never disappoints, can't say that Shady Grove is anything tremendous. I will say that Happy Hour is a great time to grab some drinks here and maybe stop in for the daily food deal. My $5 tacos were definitely worth it!   The beer selection is standard with a few craft beers on tap but mostly just your average Yuengling, Blue Moon and the sorts is what people go for.

aZmG0ZFJ3YvwzzLVLvymMA.text: Salads are my staple at this spot and they are HUGE! 1/2 price wine bottles on Wednesday and Friday make drinking here affordable. Upstairs gets a little "clubby" when they have a DJ, but much classier than most southside bars.

Sa-quKHfegI4yDwxNspFyg.text: I've only been here once but the one time I came the food was really good!   I got the southwestern blackened mahi mahi salad and it was delicious! I actually liked it so much that I've recreated it at home and now it's part of my regular cooking rotation. They also serve it in a giant mixing bowl which I thought was odd at first but in the end it just means you get a lot more salad than your average serving! I also got some sweet potato tatter tots which were tasty as well.  It took us some time to get a table (party of 4) since the place is kind of small and the food is not cheap (around $13-15 a dish) but it's definitely worth it every once in a while!

cFoF8AxZKtvp899C4cLGBQ.text: Great place.  Went first time in July.  Loved the open atmosphere, sports on tv, trendy music and excellent food.  Try the nachos!!!  So much food we couldn't eat it all but I will go back for more.  Service was also very good.

Ly9D0mISmg1T5wnkgTuzqg.text: This is a place I have been many times in college meeting friends for dinner and drinks. I have not been back in a long time and was pleasantly surprised at how great our dinner was.  We were seated quickly downstairs (it does get very busy on Friday and Saturday nights) and our friendly waitress took our drink order. They typically have a nice draft list and I went with my favorite the Leinie cranberry/ginger. The menu had so many great options from salads to wraps and burgers.  The salad options were so impressive and I went with the Greek salad which was served in a huge salad bowl. The dressing was delicious- what I liked is the dressing was not too oily and came with olives, feta cheese, cucumbers, onions and banana peppers.  Lot of fresh ingredients with a great taste.  My friend went with one of the wraps and I really like how you have an option of a few sides instead of getting fries.

tVmpPPIT_x8s44kzBnxxCA.text: It was loud, but a nice atmosphere. The salad I had was served in a giant bowl and would have been perfect if it would have had more than a couple bites of chicken in it. The rest of it was pretty good, though. The server was attentive. The bar made fine drinks. Overall, it was great, except for the seats we had must have been right under the ac vents.

photos.caption: Photo of Shady Grove - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

2mDx1ESVX2f5pysFfjo2BQ.text: Half priced burger on Monday's is all you need to know. They got a good beer selection at awesome prices, and the food is consistently great. Not just pub food. Good pizzas, burgers are really good...a great Shadyside staple that deserves all the business it gets.

oR1za0u5IBHOAMzA0X3Y6g.text: We had to wait for a table forever, they kept seating people ahead of us.  I asked to speak to a manager and she came over and said oh sorry and walked away.  The waitress gave us an attitude the whole time.  4 out of the 5 of us got our food at the same time. The 5 the person had to wait 10 more minutes.  The food was ok, lobster was cold and tasteless, fries were good.   Would not recommend.  First time and last time eating here!

2nLrubGTY6kMHDFozMH-sw.text: I've eaten here a few times now, and the food is good enough to keep me coming back when I am in the mood for typical American style cuisine at a relatively inexpensive price.  All the food I've had here has been good except for the few times that I've had sandwiches slathered with so much aeoli that I thought my taste buds and breath would never recover.  The interior could use a little bit of renovation since it appears to be somewhat beat up.  The service I've had has always been prompt and polite.

z_vMSETIxFslNgWDK6-zOw.text: Shady Grove has one of my favorite burgers. The Shady Burger has cheese, bacon, and an egg on it, and it's killer. The burgers also come with a side of fries, which are perfectly seasoned and breaded. If you like appetizers, they have a really wide variety, including potstickers, buffalo chicken dip, waffle fries, Thai shrimp sliders, and more. For dessert, there are three options which all involve a chocolate chip cookie. If you're looking for somewhere to go out, Wednesday's are half-off wine night, and the place is packed!

TedAioI81CuQhVPgVmQhkA.text: For lunch: Good pizza, sweet potato tots were a weird consistency like crunchy on the outside but then raw and undercooked on the inside.   For night life: INCONSISTENT. going here to dance at night is fun but it's really hit or miss. sometimes it's crowded AF, sometimes it's pretty empty, sometimes the music is great, sometimes it's like wth is the Dj playing...

VYs5pXjOIvNTPjC1sBYQ2w.text: This is one of my favorite places for lunch in shadyside.  The salads were perfect size!  The summer salad was so light and delicious.  And my daughter and my friends were equally delicious!  Then there was our server... fun, attentive, and just excellent.  It was so relaxed and best of all we were able to have conversations without talking loud because of the noise level.  We went on a Saturday but I hear Sunday has $4 mimosas. Another time!

mg4K8-dwRvG-czn3-GYXsg.text: Big menu with lots of delicious options. I got the Bloomfield pizza (added mushroom) and it was big for the price. Will be returning for sure.

photos.caption: Photo of Shady Grove - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

VKBxZ5-zhc_oVaFlVFXneA.text: Some places you just go to for the outdoor seating.   As a vegan you have to take the good with the bad. Not that this place is "bad" per se, but there are few options. And very few that are healthy at that.   Service was friendly and pretty quick - the bottled beer my husband chose was expired by a few months - whoops!  Great, quick-ish, place to meet up with friends after work on a nice day out and midweek there was a lot of outdoor seating to choose from.   Typical "hummus & dip type offerings for the vegan lot.

20v0vbd5YONBNJgmWzJURg.text: I'm actually pretty surprised by the lackluster reviews! I have been living in Pittsburgh and coming here pretty frequently for 4 years. The service is totally average, I've never had any negative experience though. I love that they have a big menu, yet I've never ordered something that I didn't LOVE. In terms of American restaurants, Shady Grove is my ideal. I don't frequently get drinks here for two reasons: moreso because the food is so filling I can't have more than water, but also because the prices aren't that great. However, they do have some nice food and drink specials if you plan ahead to come on a night with your special of choice. I love the half priced burger night, it's amazing to get a really solid burger (and delicious fries) for 7 or 8 dollars. If you are hesitant from the reviews, I recommend you give Shady Grove a try before you overlook them!

4otzfp3syYoq-KXLjbG3bw.text: Had Jamaican Jerk Mahi Mahi Tuna tacos 3 medium sized tacos with mango corn salsa and real good sauce.  Tuna was done perfectly. Place was super noisy on second floor. Enjoyed live music on Thursday night. Wait was trackable on yelp which was good and got a text when table was ready. second floor seating is just ok prob would like balcony seating better however long wait.

5JBnNCcZ68kwgkzpEmTZYg.text: Had a great dinner and drinks with coworkers after our shift (within easy walking distance from Shadyside Hospital). We shared the loaded latkes appetizer, which was delicious. For entrees, we ordered the fish tacos, a Caesar salad, and the Waldorf salad. The three tacos a single person can eat, but the salads come in large silver metal bowls and are really enough for two servings. All were delicious. There are large selective of beer and wine, as well as a few cocktails. I am finishing my excellent Wild Old Fashion as I type this. This place functions well as a restaurant-cum-bar.

photos.caption: Photo of Shady Grove - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Waldorf salad with two kinds of viniagrette.
Photo of Shady Grove - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

20SKhxVJ3uPWKpJn441I4A.text: As a whole, four stars but if going for happy hour or a daily special then Shady Grove deserves six (yeah, I know the max is five)! Shady Grove is a nice place right in the heart of Shadyside. They have a great happy hour with beer and wine selections along with daily food/drink specials. Let me recommend going on a Monday evening after 5pm. Happy hour runs from 5-7pm and burgers are half price after 5pm! It is such an amazing deal! Staff always seems kind and the specials truly can't be beat! I love Shady Grove's happy hour so much that I included it in a blog: nataliezazula.com/advent...

photos.caption: Photo of Shady Grove - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Turkey burger with smoked gouda, lettuce, tomato, avocado and pineapple salsa!
Photo of Shady Grove - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Monday evening specials.

exOQ53nF0FGMNspLSlXdrg.text: This is probably my favorite restaurant in Shadyside. There is a huge menu with lots to choose from and whatever you pick is bound to be good. The French onion soup is to die for and they also broil cheese over their tomato soup. The staff is friendly and it's a nice atmosphere. I highly recommend stopping in for a drink and a bite if you're in the area.

cjHaDXYx47xvQFYlG87ahw.text: My husband and I ordered a Korean fried chicken sandwich, Puerto Rican chicken sandwich, and pierogi pizza. The food tasted just OK. The waitress did bring drink refills. I would return only if I had no other options for food.

YAFcJqTIc158j-Pj0h6zQA.text: I've tried this place twice, mainly for the half price wine bottles which is why I even came back a second time. The food here taste store bought, not quality at all. The first time I went for a wine night and it was hot so I had an ice cream sandwich. I don't know how an ice cream sandwich can be terrible but it was. It tasted like they went to their local grocery freezer section, grabbed the cheapest box of ice cream sandwiches and threw one on a plate.   Then this past weekend I ordered the hummus. Worst hummus I ever tasted in my life, like it came straight from a grocery store. It was runny and overall tasted like something you buy in bulk at Sam's Club. I'll probably be back again for the wine, I just know to eat before I get there.

o7neSCpAIle3ooEe3R8tmw.text: One of my favorite locations in Shadyside! With a variety of happy hour options throughout the week and a menu that has something for everyone, it's a must-try if you find yourself in this neighborhood. Plus, two-levels of seating and outside seating provides a wide range of ambience for your choosing. I've had many menu items, but my go to appetizer is the fried green tomatoes and the Bloomfield pizza is to die for as an entree!

photos.caption: Photo of Shady Grove - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Bloomfield Pizza

Om2JRXqa2hZ-XSctJiQzbg.text: reliable bar food place.  good vibe.

w3B-WHV_sc8ceelh-UFLYQ.text: I went to Shady Grove to break my fast and the hostess and the waitress (Chloe) were extremely friendly and understanding towards my friend and I! They gave me my Diablo burger quickly and it tasted extremely good! The cookie cake dessert was also delicious and really hit the spot. Would definitely come back. Also on mondays, burgers are half off which is a huge plus

photos.caption: Photo of Shady Grove - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Shady Grove - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

q-XVhjRYkjoOYODKZ-22Fw.text: Girls night out...out and about in shadyside..  Sunday evening.  We decided on "Shady Grove" and so happy on our choice. The food and service was excellent.  We only had to wait for a few minutes to be seated.  A table opened up outside.  Our server "Liz" was on it.. she was on top of our cocktails and food.  For appetizers we had Cajun rub wings:  which were good cooked well done as I like it.. but tasted like seasoned salt and paprika or chili powder..  there wasn't much to the cajun flavoring..  - was "ok".  I had wished  I had tried the hot.. wondered how that flavor was.   Mango Salsa:  how refreshing and flavorful!  Choice of pita/chips or both.. we decided to live on the edge and chose both!!   I really liked the menu.  There was something for everyone..  and especially liked the added "sunny side up - egg" options on some of the dishes.  I had a tough time deciding .. there was plenty of options of sandwiches/wraps and even pizza.  I decided on the "steakhouse burger" and it was A M A Z I N G .. definitely one of the best burgers that I have had in the burg:  angus burger, smoked gouda, sauteed spinach, onion straws, bacon, lettuce and tomato $11.00 - definitely worth it.    Parking was tough but with some patience we managed to find a spot in the public parking lots a street behind walnut.    Thanks Shady Grove!

photos.caption: Photo of Shady Grove - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Steakhouse Burger=excellent
Photo of Shady Grove - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. cute ladies room
Photo of Shady Grove - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. mango salsa

kp8fQ2L95HFV1PLHr-x6UA.text: Shady Grove was always a favorite place to go after work for dinner or a weekend lunch break, when living and working on Fifth Avenue in Shadyside. The food and the service has always been excellent. I have never had a bad experience dining at Shady Grove. It is also a great place for a Sunday Brunch. I love the salads. My favorite is the Chicken Ceaser. I also like the Ahi Tuna. You can't beat a $3 Mimosa on a Sunday.  They offer a small wine list, but I have enjoy a few glasses. I really like the 1/2 price wine Weds. They don't take reservations, but it does fill up quickly on a good day. Highly Recommend.

BYxAP94qwZAG9Pj1nC7GwQ.text: I went here with a group and one person who swore it was great. So nice! A great atmosphere. Adorable sign. Lovely weather outside. End of story.  Too much fried stuff. I'd say if u got anything make it the catfish because at least u get some veggies.  Other than that - skip it. .

5IsBEN6TgR1l92gcKeKDug.text: I came here on Sunday night with about 8 friends to watch the Steelers game. The waitress was very friendly and helpful. The menu had many different options (tacos, sandwiches, hamburgers, salads). I ordered the Shady Burger and it was delicious! I would definitely recommend ordering it. The side of fries were pretty good, but nothing spectacular.   I'd definitely come back again to try their other hamburgers!

8AaLXy_gBIW0OSTspHepdQ.text: I've been here twice and each time I walked away very happy.  The food is decently healthy; my second trip was with a friend with a specific diet so she won't get sick and it was such a great option - and the price is just perfect! I got a wrap with fries and she got a wrap with a salad.  I'm not a super fan of the fries because they are a tad greasy (but if you like your fries that way, then this is the place!), I think next time I'll go for a salad instead.  My dad ordered the Cobb Salad and enjoyed it - it was a very large portion.  Both times I ate here, I walked away with extra food for another day's meal.  Heating it up didn't ruin it either.  I went with the General Tso's Chicken and Pesto Chicken - I'd recommend both!  Only negative was I felt I had to yell a lot to talk to my friend when we were seated close to the bar.

ww2LoSvQHcNTOfsK6aOBeQ.text: Amazing amazing food.  I have been to shady grove multiple times in the past year and the food never displeases me, you get a lot for the amount you pay.  Highly recommend the chicken chili nachos, spinach and artichoke dip, and the chicken spinach and artichoke sandwich.  Although the service may not be the best, the food is definitely worth it.  They also have great drink specials throughout the week.

Ucgrtxvbgbs_RJGaWmv-4g.text: I had the Pesto Burger and it was great. The service was alright. It's definitely more of a bar atmosphere, and of course since its in Shadyside, it's a pretty hipster-y place. I definitely want to go back to try the gourmet pizzas.

3IFiQt5xjSfFmtmz86B9Gg.text: A Shadyside staple, this place is great for lunch while shopping Walnut, dinner, or late night. Last night my friends and I stopped here and it was at it's usual capacity, upstairs and downstairs, with decent music playing. It's a good local bar, nothing too crazy going on, and good for a final stop before heading home.

Y2TqHZdjIAYjGDmjXjUe0g.text: Atmosphere is nice bar/pub style with outside seating. Staff is friendly but service is slow. I had dinner there alone at 6pm on a weekday and it took them 30 min to bring the incorrect order then another 5 min to correct it. I am visiting this area, but where I come from a Medium burger means pink in the middle. My late arriving burger was burned on the outside and cooked all the way thru.  Sweet potato tots were sweet and tasty. Overall, just okay. Nothing special. Probably would not come here again.  Lots of great restaurants to try.

xQdMNaLHMEZEFLRM10TtIQ.text: My friends and I go to Shady Grove very often. We are able to meet for a great meal, or to meet up for a evening drink. The bar staff is great, show them respect and they will keep an eye out for you. Most of their wait staff are friendly and attentive.  Late Friday and Saturday the bar becomes standing room only and can become loud. But if you are looking for a nice place with good food, nice staff, and tasty drinks stop in.

mKleaoU0sUhS1kZ6150VbA.text: Was in Pittsburgh visiting for the weekend from Philly.  We were in Shadyside for the afternoon doing some shopping and we decided to eat here.  Sure enough I loved it!  We ordered the onion rings as an appetizer. First the portions were generous but more importantly they were perfectly cooked and battered. (I hate when the onion falls out because of a lack of batter or sogginess due to a bad mix)    If you like sweet potatoes, make sure you get the sweet potato tots as a side.  They went great with my pesto burger (which was also great).  Overall it was worth the lunch time wait.  I will definitely go back when I am in Pittsburgh.

nzCF3gty7kda-2Nxaxk92w.text: This place is consistently a solid 3 out of 5. That's more than most places can claim.  When it's crowded it's a 2 out of 5, because the bar is shaped a little strange since it gives the bartenders more room than the customers. The mixed drinks are a 4 out of 5 most of the time, depending on your bartender. The bar looks cool inside, and the location is right in the middle of Shadyside.  It's very close to the garage, so parking is easy if you can't find a street spot. The service is usually pretty good, except when it's really busy, which is understandable. This is a consistently good happy hour place that's close to home if you live in or around Shadyside. It is what it is, and it's pretty good at it most of the time.  In the summer when they set up the outside tables, this is one of the best places to hang out on Walnut as long as its not too crowded.   Also - try the Ahi tuna appetizer, the Turkey Pesto Wrap, and the pizza after you've had a few.

F-J9lFkek_sMHFRsdwKt2w.text: Shady Grove has good food. They have wraps, salads, and pizzas - and a servicable beer & mix drink menu. It's a good place to go and have a conversation over dinner - not that it's quiet, but I remember having a good conversation every time I've gone there.  After 10 they go 21+ and have cheap pitchers.

-p6D-iXzxQjMRlRSLmIZLg.text: Food is solid, especially for a place whose main focus is on being a bar and a see-and-be-seen spot.  Pleasantly surprised by very good, prompt and friendly service.    Wouldn't go here as a destination for a meal, but when you're on Walnut and aren't up for the usual bar fare or one of the more upscale places it's a good compromise with reliably decent to very good food.

AgEixnZ7xk5uYzR0GY7OcQ.text: i came here for taco tuesday, so I didn't have anything else besides their salsa fresca appetizer and their beef and chicken tacos.  much like PJ's pub, a small bar nestled between dorm buildings at Johns Hopkins in Baltimore, MD, both places offered a pretty unauthentic selection of tacos for taco tuesdays.  i used to enjoy ordering 6-7 small tacos and a corona to wash them down. i was seeking the same experience here in pittsburgh.  the tacos are definitely a step up from those in that baltimore pub, but are also a tad more expensive. i was happy to have found a place hearby for cheap tacos, however, so I'll probably be coming back for those.  however, STAY AWAY from the salsa fresca appetizer. priced at 5 (or 6?) bucks, they throw an extremely bland version of their pico de gallo (made with at most 2 jalapeno slices), in a quantity no larger than half of a salsa container at chipotle, along a bed of chips (which actually weren't that bad...reminded me a bit of la salsa's chips (a mexican fast food restaurant chain in CA)).  this almost ruined the whole taco tuesday deal day for me.  i'll probably go back for taco tuesdays, simply due to location.

Zb2OuekYbrL1tCKjbMMEYg.text: Drinks get an A+ for kind service adn great prices, the food ranks in at about a B/B-. I Had the ahi tuna for $9.. it was koay, and I give them props for having it on the menu as it's not typical bar food for Pittsburgh, but a very popular drinks accompaniment in Miami. If I return, I'll definitely go for the classic fried finger food. Had a few beers, each on draft for $1.42.. Awesome! The crowd filtered in for happy hour, and it was the most packed around 6. Overall, I'd do it again. Perhaps for a more formal seating in the upstairs restaurant, Walnut Grill. It seems to operate from the same kitchen and under the same management...  Since the great drink prices resonate as most memorable, I've added it to my "Party in the 'Burgh" list.

cH5wiLkxlY7DI-wFl28keg.text: You know it's going to be a long week when it's Monday night and already you are too lazy to cook.  Luckily, I've got this sweet new gig that allows me to justify going out to dinner pretty much whenever I please (and can afford it)!   On this creepy fall evening, I decided to head to Walnut Street in Shadyside.  We wanted some "low-key" good, ol' American food.  We headed to Shady Grove.  Shady Grove is actually the downstairs sibling of the Walnut Grill/Shady Grove pair, and I gotta say, they definitely got the "grove" thing down pat.  The dining room is a long, narrow space with sparse lighting.  There were about 6 lights in the dining area, and in fact, I think most of the light in the room came either from the large garage door windows or the large  TVs hanging above the bar.  The dim lighting was actually pretty annoying; I like to SEE what I'm eating- too grove-y for me.  Looking around, I noticed that the diners were mostly twenty-something kids, on dates or in groups. There were a few ...um...mature adults enjoying wine with dinner in the back of the room.  I have a tendency to notice the background music at restaurants.  No doubt about it, music plays a big part in setting the "vibe" of the place.  I suppose that's why I was a little bit confused when the Fresh Prince of Bel-Air theme- song came on; really, Shady Grove...the Fresh Prince song??  I mean, sure I loved that show when I was eleven, but in 2009?  At dinner?!  I wanted to throw that song out the front door like Uncle Phil did to Jazzy Jeff.  The bar boasted a couple of specials that night: half-priced margaritas and half-priced draft beers.  I noticed that the Martini list wasn't much of a martini list at all, but really just a list of various Three Olives brand flavored vodkas mixed with pomegranate juice...not very inventive.  My roommate and I started with classic margaritas, but they were AWFUL, nothing more than terrible sweet & sour mix & ice.   The waitress was pretty cool about us sending those drinks back, and we ordered new libations.  Brianna (the roommate) ordered something called a "Posmo," and said it was "much better" than the margarita.  (I think that's a cosmopolitan with pomegranate juice instead of cranberry.  Fun!)  My pal Emily enjoyed her "Pomenade."  I just had a Yuengling draft, as I wasn't in the mood for a pomegranate drink and the bar was out of the other beer I tried to order (Southern Tier Brewing Company's Pumking...Mmm).  In Shady Grove's defense, it is the end of the fall beer season, so I guess I can understand running out.  In fact, Shady Grove was out of several menu items that night, and I was pretty annoyed that the waitress didn't tell us that up front.  I was looking forward to trying something called the Eggplant Tower; it was listed as a "Shady Signature" dish.  Too bad...they were out of eggplant.  No beer.  No eggplant.   I know it was just bad timing, but sheesh!  Eventually, we had a nice heap of grilled chicken nachos sitting on our table.   The nachos were actually a great size for three hungry ladies to share.  I was happy to see an abundance of jalapenos (that way we didn't have to ration peppers; we all love hot food!)  Unfortunately, the rest of the dinner didn't quite live up to the prelude.  We shared a veggie white pizza, and we agreed that it was actually pretty gross.  There was no taste in the crust, there was no taste to the sauce (if it even had sauce on it), and the veggies did not mesh together well.  We should have skipped the pizza altogether.  I will say that I had intense food envy when the table next to ours was given a huge platter of hot wings.  I love hot wings...why didn't I just get the hot wings?  Stupid trendy menu.  Stupid vegetables.  I get the impression that this is a bar that specializes in bar food.  I appreciate that Shady Grove is trying to spice things up with some adventurous drinks and dishes (what the heck is guapo, anyway?).  Unfortunately, it got away from them somewhere, and the special dishes have turned in to a waste of money.  This is a neighborhood hang-out.  Big aspirations are great, but in the end, Shady Grove is just like any other bar: kids in hoodies, eating wings & watching Sportscenter.  So...did I mention that I love hot wings?  I'd like to do a Best of Pittsburgh Hot Wings feature.  Sometime soon, I will head back to Shady Grove to try out their beautiful buffalo wings.  If you have any suggestions for restaurants with awesome hot wings, let me know!  I'd love to find the best wings in the 'burgh!  I ain't chicken! Shady Grove 5500 Walnut Street Shadyside, PA 15232 412-697-0909 OPEN: Mon-Sun, 11am-2am.

VbH1xrf_ZBBDtHmkHP56DA.text: They only had one vegetarian dish, but my boyfriend and I loved it.  Would go there every few weeks, and was okay with the service.  Last time we went there the waitress ignored our table for almost an hour.  All of the other tables around our were served a number of times, and had their drinks refilled constantly.  Our drinks (non-alcoholic) were never refilled, and my my boyfriend complained by simply saying that this is bull-**** we were asked to leave.  When I complained on Facebook the complaint was deleted, twice.  When I complained in email it was ignored.  Typically we are pretty big tippers, so I have no idea what the waitresses issue would have been, but we will NEVER go back to their restaurants, including the Walnut Grill, Walnut Grove, and Up.

GA3Te8auZOfArhuqz7cahg.text: I work on Walnut St. and I really like this place.  It has solid food, burgers, pizza etc... and is pretty decently priced for what it is.  Menu items I've had and loved include the spicy Italian sandwich, the pesto chicken sandwich, fish tacos, and the sweet potato tots or waffle fries with cheese and bacon are just junk food awesomeness.  There current drink menu features a champagne cosmo that me and my coworkers love.  They also have a special almost every day with fun stuff like half off wine night or even half off burger day.  Because I work on Walnut I've never really come for dinner, but in summer they have outdoor seating at lunch which is fun, and it's a good happy hour place.  It's definitely worth a try, good easy food and not too pricey.

1dN7cwoUc6LFMVvi7VssEA.text: good wraps, great pizzas. decent beer selection. awesome bartenders.

Mqocr8gBpeZJOEkI-uHlNA.text: Awesome sandwiches and pizza, great service, good price, and good drinks - and not too expensive.  At the bar there is a large mixed drink selection and I have enjoyed everything.  I lived in Shadyside and came here way more than I should have, and was never disappointed.  Highly recommend!

5h0DwrrcWPARJ_bMfo5UOQ.text: I personally rarely come here specifically to eat. I do love to come here for the atmosphere/drinks/girls. Their waitresses are for the most part really hot!!!  The Food: personally I like the combo of onion soup and the shady burger (yea its not the best burger in town, but its got a great taste to it). Rest of their food is so-so, and some of it is down right awful, but again... i don't come here for the food.  The Atmosphere: LOVE the atmosphere!! There is outdoor seating, there are lots of windows, there is a jukebox upstairs, there is a fun bar area downstairs with lots of TV's so you can watch the game with buddies over some drinks. There are always very attractive people here.  Waitresses: really hot! really nice! great service!  This is def my favorite bar in shadyside, but again, I don't come here for the food! (except maybe the soup).

Kh_acg4PKeHEdvJYay0CFw.text: Shady Grove is one of my favorite bars in Shadyside! Yes, it gets overly crowded but there is an upstairs and always a place to stand. Drinks are cheap there and I met a few people at this place. I would recommend this bar if you like a high class friendly atmosphere.

FeLWta0BHwArB9NxuEtlHA.text: Went to Shady Grove this afternoon and sat at the bar for a quick lunch.  It was anything but!  I originally went to order one of their "taters" - a loaded baked potato and the server told me, sorry we don't have them and that we are in the process of changing the menu.  Thanks...then I waited 25 minutes for her to bring my second choice.  The BBQ chicken wrap was okay as far as nourishment is concerned.  I wouldn't go back.  It looks like a cute cafe from the outside but its clear this place is a bar, serving bar food with bar service and bar atmosphere.

KLwRU4Ma8pq9GVdMhTj0Tw.text: Holy hot cocktailers batman!! And gangster rap any time after 8 pm. And two dollar beers and half priced margaritas on Thursdays. My service has always been prompt and friendly. The food is indeed mediocre but beer is pretty hard to screw up. It just has to be cold, which it is. God Bless I say!

VyvFv1HyqWWBYbvdYnXi7w.text: I used to come here quite often for late-night drinks, but just recently started coming in for lunch. The service is consistent, and they have great salads/pizza/sandwiches, and super yummy fries! Somehow I ended up here 3 times last week (twice for lunch and once for happy hour), so I got a chance to try each of my favorites. My favorites are the Greek salad, BBQ chicken pizza, the Hawaiian pizza, and this week's discovery - the Hot Veggie sandwich.  Really, you can't go wrong with any of the pizzas though. The crust has a sweet flavor to it that really sets it apart from any other pizza in the area. Just thinking about it is making my mouth water...

6pidwy2ofUcrs6Hvo_ybSA.text: Ha!  I'll get on the 3 starts bandwagon... even though I enjoy my times here.  If's a fun crowd, and beyond that, much much more.  Beer and food are fine, noting special!

_MYXWQiHWlzBFd6p9Aq0hw.text: Great lunch spot, with a nice covered outdoor patio.  Solid well-priced food.  Chicken salad melt and platter good.  Seems like this would be a great spot on the nights when they have specials, ESP 1/2 priced bottles of wine.  Excellent friendly service, cute waitresses.  Fast.  Only observation, raised by another Yelper, was the smell of the trash bin on the far right side of the patio.  Only blessing, it is not hot or humid today. I think it's a good casual element to Shadyside.

GDce6C5c2ESExhN7M0VdxQ.text: There's nothing really special here.  The service is slow at the bar and the tables, the place is crowded with Affliction/Ed Hardy T-shirt wearing type guys.  The music is truly terrible dance-pop nonsense.  The food is forgettable without being bad: think Chilis or Outback.    On the plus side, they do have some good beers available.  But this is Pittsburgh, and that's not unusual at all.  In fact, you can walk a few blocks, say to Bites and Brews or Harris Grill and get an even better selection, usually for the same price or better.

5ivIa4a6rcyqeeSl2RnP6Q.text: Half price wine bottles Wednesdays.  Get the shady sticks.  Eat'em when they're still hot.   Yum.

tpjkumwZxB-X70BVf__ZJw.text: This is probably one of the most popular bars in Shadyside.  They have a  great wine bottle special, and decent (not great) prices otherwise.  The decor is really nice and posh...it kind of makes you want to put on a collared shirt.  The food is also decent, though not spectacular.  Definitely a nice lunch stopover though.   The problem with the bar is the crowd at night.  I mean it is CROWDED.  It's next to impossible to get a drink at the bar or from the wait staff, who are really trying their best but are just overwhelmed with people!   Drinks are made ok...I wasn't overly impressed.
