I want to like the bar more, but the crowds keep annoying me to the point of wanting to leave.  Also, the bar is really packed with the douchiest people in Shadyside as well, so not only are you crowded into oblivion, but also it's like a Jersey Shore episode in there...not fun.    Overall, it's not a bad place.  The drinks and such are done ok, bue the crowd is just overwhelming at all times.  I'd go elsewhere if given the option.

ado7YlDxya9k0MHs4IfLvA.text: I'm reviewing this place as a bar, that sometimes I eat at.  Rather than a restaurant, that I happen to have some drinks at....  Using this lens - this place is pretty good.  Specifically - the pizza is very good.  Shady sticks as an appetizer - also great.  (think pokey sticks if you went to penn state and ever ordered from Gumby's)  I was there again this past Sunday and had a Greek salad.  It exceeded my expectations.  I've been many times over the past year, and I believe they've made some improvements to their salad options.  I was pleased!    I haven't had the burgers or sandwiches lately, so won't comment on their flavor - but their menu is extensive - so there are many many options.  (Again, compared to a BAR - not another restaurant)  Wednesday night is wine night - half off bottles of wine.  Which is a wonderful headache inducing special.    The place is usually packed after 7pm - every night.  Little room to move, no seats, etc.  And yes - there are a fare number of Ed Hardy and Affliction shirts.  I'm only giving this a 3 star, because the atmosphere and service drive me nuts sometimes.  Food and drinks alone, would warrant a better review.  If you're not interested in the mayhem...try them out for a weekend lunch.  A great stop if doing some Walnut Street shopping.

bMOFeGA8SUq8-h8JLNWsQw.text: Great place for some social drinking after hours.  You really cannot complain about a place that is packed with university students, drinks, and food.  It going to be an interesting night, anyway you look at it.    So there are two parts to the this place, the downstairs bar and seating area.  If this area just seems to packed to find somewhere to sit, move along to the back and find the stairs that head up to the second bar area upstairs.  I spent most of my time upstairs where there was a jukebox blasting top 40's and hip hop.  The bartender actually made me put more money into the jukebox when the music stopped saying she was not going to serve until there were beats.  Well after some bar food and beers, the night was under way.  And the place stayed packed until closing.  Summary- $2 Dos Equis on Thursdays you have got to be kidding me!

dTr7sSdAHho0ZGcr2ZEp1g.text: Let me begin this by saying that the reason they are getting this rating is for lack of consistency.  I was a shadyside resident for quite sometime and spent many afternoons and evenings in Shady Grove and Walnut Grill. Shady Grove has been the less consistent of the two for me over the years. For New Years Eve this year, my friends made dinner reservations for us at Walnut Grill and then we went downstairs for drinks and to ring in 2012. This review is only about Shady Grove, as my experiences at Walnut Grill have been pretty good.   Shady grove food is good and the drinks are reasonably priced. The space is cool and in the summer they have outdoor seating, which I love. Wine nights on Wednesdays cannot be beat-half priced bottles all evening. The reason for the 3 rating? The service is SO inconsistent. I've had visits where my service is appalling, and then visits where my service is grand. When I say appalling, I mean a waitress poured water on my feet and all over the floor, and told me not to slip when I left, rather than giving me a towel to dry my freezing toes. And even on NYE, the service was very inconsistent. One bartender would be great. Another would be just awful-horrible attitude, ignoring sections of the bar, etc. It is really a shame. It seems like certain employees (in particular a broad fellow with dark hair-not wearing the uniform...perhaps a manager?) are there just to meet girls and act like a hot shot. He was behind the bar, not serving anyone, as if to give the impression that he owns the place (which I know he does not), and was hitting on a girl in my group HARD. He was just trying to look like a big shot. Annoying. Make a drink for the people waiting and stop trying to hook up with uninterested women. Thanks.   That being said, it is usually a cool crowd there. Great location. Usually I have no trouble finding parking. So all in all...Good food. Good Vibe. Good  drinks. Some great servers. Some crabby servers. Big guy with the dark hair? Try to get laid on your own time.  Happy New Year!

kR3gOkp_dOD_b4g_A2H6Ag.text: Great neighborhood bar, above average food, friendly staff. The shady burger, shoshito peppers and jalapeno popper dip are all awesome !

hZQInLxmUaZ_oWFjqEA3hQ.text: Although some others have listed Shady Grove as a bit mediocre I believe it is a pretty cool place.  Atmosphere: There are lots of big screen tvs and usually plenty of seating if you don't go during happy hour or high noon you should be okay.  I've eaten their with my folks during the day and the service has been quite fast.  I've also eaten with a large group of friends during a hockey game which took a bit longer but still was expected with a large group.  The late night scene is enjoyable.  Lots of college and graduate students and a large batch of 25yr+ people.  There is an open bar and drinks are fairly large.  Shots are quite large, coke and rums are good.  I am not sure if there is a special drink offered but I've always enjoyed myself there at night no matter what I drink.  Staff: The staff is pretty prompt.  It is quite a large place so sometimes if you are with a larger group you have to expect it to take a bit longer.  Sometimes I've been a bit surprised at how fast the food has come out though so you never know.  Food: I think that the food here is good.  I would put some of the dishes on the same level as Cappy's down the street but others are outstanding.  I've had salads, quesadillas, burgers, wings, chicken finger platters, etc.  They have a great selection so if you are wish a group of people who are in the mood for a wide variety of foods it is definitely the place to go!

wSbXTq5YGNjoUsGtQHIw9A.text: This was just average.  The food was average but at least they don't charge more than they should for it.  However, this is not the case with their provolone wedges.  $6 for 3 pieces, seriously??  A huge ripoff.  I had the Shady Burger which is an angus burger with a sunny side up egg in it.  It was ok but for some reason the American cheese in it really got to me.  It was difficult for me to finish the burger because it also reminded me of ordinary-to-bad backyard grilling that my dad used to do.  I ordered a medium burger but it was essentially well-done, with some burn.  I'm also not a huge fan of sunny side up eggs (but my being a fan of eggs overpowered this so I still ordered the Shady burger) and with good reason -- dribbleeee.  It was a mess.  I loved the super crispy french fries though.    Service was decent.  Atmosphere is decent.  It was nice to be able to sit outside.

-7yI7ogfMuj-MkgKC_hp0A.text: First two times I went here, the service wasn't anything special, but the food - incredible. My small pizza was worth every penny, I ate every bite. My bf got some steak sandwich and it came out with a whole fried egg on top - he looked like he was in heaven. Last time we went there, it was half-off bottles of wine night (Wednesdays), which was a great deal. Place was beyond crowded, but it was worth it - cheap wine, great server, amazing food.

BY5eLL-xhqSlK1Z_A9vMOA.text: Wanted to go somewhere I hadn't been before and realized that despite always passing it I have never been.  So I went, and it looked promising from the outside.  Our waitress was attentive and people seemed to be enjoying themselves.  I ordered the Jerk Mahi Mahi on Kaiser and my fiancee ordered the Caprese Sandwich.  This is where things started to fall apart.   My sandwich came on a hamburger bun, not a Kaiser roll and the fish was mediocre to decent, nothing to write home about, but the jerk rub was not nearly as spicy as a jerk rub should be.  On the menu the Caprese Sandwich is vegetarian and says "Add chicken $3."  The sandwich came with chicken which we did not order, when we asked the waitress she said that it automatically comes with chicken (and therefore also comes automatically for $11 instead of $8), if we didn't want chicken we had to ask to have the sandwich come as it says it does on the menu.  If it automatically comes with chicken, then say that on the menu and charge $11, otherwise, only give us chicken if we ask. The fries which accompanied our sandwiches were also decent but not great, so in the end, the food was a little on the pricey side for the quality and, more importantly, not consistent with the menu from which we ordered.  All in all, a disappointment.

q5PVgk9763kUbDDsbR6W0A.text: I have a love-hate relationship with Shady Grove. I frequent this casual bar and restaurant at least once a month since I live very close. It just has a larger selection of a typical bar menu but the food is always good. I love to go to their  1/2 price "Wine Night" on Wednesdays, but the place is always way to crowded to get a table, good service or even hear what your friends are saying. I'd love it if they have more of a night scene for young professionals on the weekends, but unfortunately it just don't compare to the other bars on Walnut street.

mJTpXipW8mPlT6GVjDfFQA.text: Not sure why this place is bashed so much for the service.  I really have no qualms! Been there twice- although never on a night with drink specials (thank god). I prefer going for lunch as their sandwiches and salads are awesome.  Not to mention some of the tastiest french fries around.  Reasonably priced, tasty food with the caveat of going for lunch service only.  Not shabby.

EbaVAnSdwRAbJ4pEA2CjJQ.text: Moving here from DC, maybe I just expect too much as far as service, but I feel like my expectations in this case are standard.   Their food is delicious, there drinks are yummy, I have just been consistently disappointed by their service. Even if they are semi busy, the waitresses seem to be running around like chickens with their heads cut off. Though, the bartenders have their act together.   I came here on Monday evening...around 6/630. I ordered the Fajita wrap...I took two bites, and then noticed there was a small brown hair in my fries. My hair is long and black, so clearly it wasn't mine. When I told the waitress, she very professionally exclaimed "shit!" and came over.   I told her, I lost my appetite and just asked for a new order to go. I waited until my friend finished her meal, and then asked for the check. My waitress plopped mine down in front of me. Seriously? I ate human hair at your venue...and you're going to charge me for that? You've officially made my shit list.

358Ino1TV7F990dcm_j1iw.text: This place is a step up from traditional bar food. It's a great place to grab a cheap bite to eat or drink with friends.  I don't think the wait staff is overly friendly but I have never found them to be rude. Half priced wine nights on Wednesday is usually packed but extremely fun.  This place has a cool special pretty much every night of the week.  Happier staff would've bumped up my rating.

nPQEDD3Y0roSrPwXeQiUTw.text: I'm pretty sure my husband is having a love affair with Shady Grove. He eats lunch here at least once a week, if not more. Occasionally I have the opportunity to join him. Their sandwiches are always solid and their waffle fries are to die for. I recently tried their BBQ chicken pizza and I'm obsessed. Their pizza is fantastic.  Why a 4?  I wavered between a 4 and 5. I really wish I could give it a 4.5, but I think a 4 is more fitting. Their sandwiches are pretty good, but not quite a 5. Their beer selection is limited which also knocks it down from a 5. There is only a little room for improvement.

NQhUuII4AkzSSvGL4pcTWA.text: things white people like: shadyside.  things THIS white guy likes: sitting outside with jenn g. during the summer months and drinking in shadyside.  shady grove is exactly what the rating says "a-ok." its a great place during the afternoon to sit outside and have a drink, but once the sun goes down it gets a little bro-y.  i never thought about it before, but i guess bro's are kind of like werewolves.

-hs94GPO01gfDb2gcjLYNQ.text: I used to frequent Shady Grove in my college days, but just recently went back for a wine night. It's always a good vibe and the waitresses are friendly (more friendly than the hostesses that's for sure). Half price wine bottles on Wednesday's and other specials on different days. We got food this time. I ordered the shady sticks which are just cheese breadsticks. But honestly they weren't that good. They needed some garlic or something. It was just some cheese on bread with no type of seasoning. The bread also was oddly sweet which was kinda weird. My friend ordered wings which were just your basic wings nothing exciting.   I recommend if you're looking for a cool vibe and upstairs dancing. And if you need food it's there just don't expect it to be great.

photos.caption: Photo of Shady Grove - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Shady sticks, mediocre
Photo of Shady Grove - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Wings

AtI1blpq2O19VClJPZ-svQ.text: Sort of unclear why two Asian hostesses today at 11am decided to seat me AFTER two groups of white people came in, when I am Asian myself. I called them on it and they sort of bumbled with no real apology. Summer salad was ok; shrimp grilled well but dressing was a bit oily and too sweet. Overall I would pass given weird interaction with hostesses.

qmPkopLBGHVmGkEjIKdIig.text: Fun lively bar with an extensive menu - interesting variety of salads, appetizers, burgers, sandwiches, pizza. Had buffalo wings that were large, juicy, crispy and spicy. Excellent salads. Full bar. Highly recommended.

rlti5whGle8JSql5Iccw5A.text: The pizza is amazing. Every weekday they have a different special, such as burger Monday's, Trivia Tuesday. Great atmosphere, near walnut St, where you can walk around if there's a wait. Also great salad and sandwich options.

zKJoqZJV3ku4geLa-GE5qw.text: Stopped in here with a friend for their Monday night burger deal (1/2 price burgers after 5 pm). The restaurant was busy, but we were seated right away. I ordered the Turkey burger with my friend having the Bacon Swiss. Both burgers were cooked well, flavorful, and of good size. The menu itself was huge, with my friend reporting that she has tried several items and being satisfied with all of them. Plenty to choose from and something for everyone! The drink menu looked quite diverse as well.  The restaurant itself was clean with an upscale twist for being an older-looking bar. Definitely would stop back for any of their deal nights!

fMPjPwEUDv3KyiKUdqx3eg.text: Went here for dinner a few days ago. Asked to sit outside which was wonderful. Our server Chloe was amazing. She greeted us quickly and always kept our drinks full. We ordered the sweet potato tots and jalapeno dip for appetizers and they were amazing!! Very large portions as well. We both got pizza for dinner which was equally delicious. The prices are also very reasonable and they have different specials each day. 100% recommend this place. Ask for Chloe!

tIilv4Pqk_NVrRr47JcKEQ.text: Very happy with our visit to Shady Grove! Came here on a Monday afternoon, 93 breezy and sunny, they had the perfect spot for us to sit outside and enjoy.. Corona, mahi mahi tacos, hummus dip, & ahi tuna salad were all excellent. Very laid back vibe, great service, and many options to choose from on the menu. Will be back!

Xku1S_yiRLPN4uGJ73-Nqg.text: Just as I was leaving Pittsburgh, I finally tried this place a couple days. I came here with a large group both times. You can't beat the deals like $4 wines or $5 ciders/beers. Tuesday is happy hour specials all day, yes, ALL DAY. The jalapeno popper dip is amazing! I originally tried the spinach & artichoke dip which wasn't that great but I discovered the jalapeno dip. The waitresses and hostesses were super accommodating and chill with both of the large groups I was apart of. Looking for a good bite to eat, affordable drinks, and cool scenery? Look no further than Shady Grove!

photos.caption: Photo of Shady Grove - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Jalapeño Popper Dip

ni62Swf3jDnjTv5A13oJQg.text: Absolutely terrible!!! I decided to give shady grove a second chance and they stood up to my low expectations! The uber driver mistakenly grabbed our food after telling the host he did not think it was ours only to deliver it and we check to see that it isn't our order. When I called to speak to the manager he couldn't have been more unprofessional and only argued that he could not refund my 35$. So not only did we not get any food we also were told it was fine that we were not satisfied. He could not have been more rude or lack of understanding. I will not be wasting my money here! Avoid if possible!!!

9DrNLYnA0pKNmOgPRw9OQg.text: This is my second time at shady grove. The food here is pretty good for the price but the service is aweful. I'm out for a Father's Day dinner and my server never came over once for a refill nor to check up and see if we needed anything. Mind you we got burgers with no napkins. I ordered a side Caesar salad, gives me iceberg but doesn't mention they are out of romaine. Never came back to ask if everything was good, as a server for over years years this is so unacceptable. Ordered sweet potato tots and got French fries? Think she'd check on us, no. Disappointed.

-URg6LPTVK6izwGL7QEVaw.text: Came here for dinner on a Tuesday night and was seated right away. The interior is cute with decorative trees around with lights. We started off with the fried pickles. They were nice and tangy and tasted great with the horseradish sauce. For dinner, I had the southern fried chicken sandwich. The sandwich was huge. I was disappointed that it was not one chicken breast or patty but rather four chicken tenders. This made the sandwich quite difficult to eat. Tenders just kept falling out. The hot sauce was good and added nice flavor, but I ended up just eating some of the tenders on their own. I had ordered waffle fries, but it came with fries. The fries were fine. I could not even finish them, because the food just felt very greasy. My friends had the veggie burger and enjoyed it, but their patties kept falling apart too. Overall, Shady Grove is hit or miss with their dishes.

photos.caption: Photo of Shady Grove - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Southern fried chicken sandwich
Photo of Shady Grove - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Southern fried chicken sandwich

saW4TM41Hstpsb_bbxelXw.text: One word: AMAZING! Shady Grove did not disappoint with the happy hour specials today. Our server was an awesome IUP grad like myself and was very helpful!   My chicken nachos were surprisingly flavorful topped with beans, cheese, onions, salsa, sour cream and guacamole, all for $6! My girlfriend ordered the Pittsburgh chicken salad and was the best in town!  I can't possibly say more about Shady Grove. Stop in and find out for yourself!

photos.caption: Photo of Shady Grove - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

aXY8qgkuejz4ffhpkyEE6Q.text: Came here with my boyfriend and his dad on a Sunday afternoon. Plenty of seating was available outside and inside. I went with the Pittsburgh salad (chopped iceberg and romaine, grilled chicken,tomato, carrots, cucumbers, coleslaw, waffle fries and cheddar cheese- $12), and my boyfriend went with the Korean chicken sandwich. The wait for our food was much longer than expected, but our service was excellent. The food itself was pretty good. The portion of my salad was HUGE, which I was really impressed by. Everything tasted really fresh as well. Brendan's sandwich was good, but nothing to write home about. Overall, we had a nice meal, but I do think it's a little overpriced here. Not sure if I will rush back anytime soon.

TO1o2PQ70ZLDf4_GiWrbug.text: Food wise, I like the selection. You can find something for everyone: salads, tacos (good!), burgers, and more. I think the food quality is good for a pub so definitely come in. However, I find the music unpleasantly too loud. I understand if you go at night and want somewhat of a night club ambiance but during the day, the music is blaring and it's hard to have a conversation. So I might be tempted to go for the food but I will reconsider in the future because of the obnoxiously loud music. You can always sit outside where it is quiet but you are out of luck if it's full or cold.

k1iUjGbn8FtO3E-28KRnow.text: Shady Grove is my absolute favorite restaurant. My sister and I are regulars due to their awesome selection in food, great deals on drinks, and the staff is so nice and friendly. Flo is such an awesome waitress/bartender too!! The prices are phenomenal as well- I eat here at least once a week! They have live music sometimes too which I think is so cool.

8MjonDhQp0FHx7k6cyfe6w.text: Solid go-to in Shadyside. Sound kitchen and dedicated staff.   Consistent and solid New American fare steps away from Walnut Street. The kitchen renders the menu nicely. Serving staff is gracious and friendly, and the venue is nice, with both indoor and outdoor seating being pleasant. Great casual neighborhood restaurant. We continue to visit on a regular basis.

rgeFjw3QE804m0irQWCbRg.text: The service and food were both amazing! Our server, Hailey, was very attentive and accommodating, especially about my nut allergy. The veggie powerhouse salad and so was the Caribbean chicken salad. We came from out of town, but would definitely come back the next time we're in Pittsburgh!

Ucn12ESV1XkPHhJya_dC4g.text: Not only are the drinks good, but so is the food! I highly recommend Shazam shrimp for an appetizer! Just the right amount of crunch and spice! Even after it was over, it had me wanting more!  I also recommend the grilled shrimp tacos! Shrimp is fresh and seasoning tastes really good. I got the onion rings for a side and they were cooked just right! Not too burned, cooked the right amount and a good size.  For dessert we got the deep dish chocolate chip cookie. It was delicious! Just the right amount of chocolate and gooeyness! Only complaint is that I wish it was bigger lol!

photos.caption: Photo of Shady Grove - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Shady Grove - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Shady Grove - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

g9XqMgq_cFguGPj9u-poOQ.text: Oh shady grove! I hadn't been here in ages, but was craving a solid salad and knew I couldn't go wrong here.    There salads are HUGE and very filling.  I almost always get a pittsburgh salad (fake healthy), and shady grove does this well.  Waffle fries were delish, chicken was solid and their ranch is really good!   This time around we got the surf and turf appetizer and it's not worth it.  Would not recommend this and docking a star for the inconsistency.

photos.caption: Photo of Shady Grove - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Pittsburgh salad is great, surf and turf app was ok, the shrimp were weird...

0YMcnD28pTf_X6Uip-6DiA.text: I've heard good things about this place, and this is my first time eating here. We came for our friend's 21st which also happened to be on Easter. So we tried to order waffle fries, which were out... this restaurant is known for those aren't they?! And then there weren't any tortillas because we had tried to order chicken nachos for the table. Oh and then they didn't have PINEAPPLES for our pineapple pizza? Uh... and then no pierogis for the pierogi pizza..   Sighhhh.... well onto the food, when my friends' burgers came out, the smell was mouthwatering! And the fries were crispy! If I come again, I'd probably get the shady burger. I ordered the barbecue chicken pizza. It wasn't too sweet! I liked it. We had also ordered the shroom pizza, way too cheesy for my taste, but it also had 3 different cheeses. They were both $12 for small pizzas, but there were like 6 slices and I had only finished half.   As for service, our waitress Olivia, was really nice.  However she didn't refill our waters.... only once. And the service was quite slow. We spent two hours here.  Debating on returning again, maybe for the bar instead?

photos.caption: Photo of Shady Grove - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Shady Burger
Photo of Shady Grove - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Satisfaction survey
Photo of Shady Grove - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. BBQ chicken, shady burger, Swiss bacon burger

8HRqwuB6relqlJBjrMSeXA.text: I have only been to Shady Grove twice when I am in the area and don't feel like breaking the bank.   Both times I have ordered one of their sandwiches, the first time being a caprese wrap and the last time a chicken florentine sandwich. The Chicken Florentine was definitely the better of the two, though honestly I have not had a caprese as a sandwich that I like anywhere.  My favorite thing about this place is the $2 Mexican beers and $4 tequila shots. The tequila shots are for any tequila of your choice! Last time we were there my boyfriend and I threw back a couple of Patron Silvers. We only stopped because we had to go shopping for house stuff (being an adult sucks sometimes!). I usually go with Dos Equis, either the Lager or Amber, as my drink of choice. Can't beat tasty $2 beers.

vwTfG5sXTXQY2FopiujbaA.text: They may or may have not given me a cheap vodka when I asked for a grey goose martini.

ZIH7x__OEoP0Zg3qCvM2aA.text: Great place to hang out for dinner and drinks. Cozy atmosphere, really great menu, and half off wine on Friday night's.  The only downside is the bathrooms are upstairs, but other wise I love it there. Staff is super nice as well!

3RRUc33pQK_JOiUe87zuNA.text: I have enjoyed numerous experiences at Shady Grove. However, when I went there recently, it resulted in a horrible stomachache. I am not sure which of the dishes I got which were the thai shrimp tacos, summer salad, and The Goat pizza. I will not be going back anytime soon.

tLJ23WHYxhuFkMHn6vV5hQ.text: The drink specials are good. The atmosphere and decoration is awesome.  The service B-L-O-W-S. Our server was exceptionally horrible. Who takes away someones empty beer in the middle of the meal and doesn't ask if they want another? Thought she'd just come back with one but instead she didn't come back. Had to flag her down to get a bill and go find her to cash out. I'd like to go back to the downstairs and sit at the bar to eat and see if the service can be better because I really wanted this one to be good. Oh yeah, and the upstairs really smells bad. Did anyone else notice that one?

C8KgtcyyJkl3gcFDBEz6HQ.text: We had the 1/2 off burgers last night. Great burgers. Good atmosphere. Nice staff. They left the main door open (even we asked them to close) and the room was freezing cold which made us rush our meal.

w5lhoqX_wvyBedYmGiKWxQ.text: Shady grove has always been one of my favorite places to go in Pittsburgh especially when I'm down on Walnut st. Their buffalo chicken dip is so good along with their French fries and ranch. Yum! I am also a big fan of their Pittsburgh chicken salad as well as their chicken florentine wrap. My friends rave about their pizza since the crust is made with sweet dough.. So you get a hint of sweetness with every bite. I only had one bad experience here a few years ago. My food came out pretty cold.. However, I told our waitress and she brought back a whole new plate. Other than that, this is a place to check out!

PqWCqPFSqVDFyW13WAAaJA.text: Stopped here recently with friends after work. We were seated quickly in the back of the restaurant and quickly ordered a bottle of wine. Wine was good but it was not cold enough. The spinach and artichoke dip we shared to start was delicious. Big pieces of artichoke and soft pita. I had the BBQ chicken salad. This salad was huge and pretty good. Lots of chicken, BBQ sauce, fried onions, and cheese over a huge bowl of iceberg lettuce. I'll be back. It was the prefect stop after a particularly bad day.

VATw02-Um0b8tMMQa79wMQ.text: Decided to meet up with two friends here on Tuesday. We met at 6pm, which was perfect since it wasn't too busy yet (filled up by 7:30pm). We quickly had a table (opted for inside) and caught the second half of happy hour (5-7pm), which offered half price cocktails ($9-11 usually) and selected glasses of wine for $4. My two female friends were big fans of their Bellinis and I stuck with a Whiskey Mojito which was decent.  We started off with an appetizer of their dipsticks, which are pizza dough with spinach artichoke dip on top with ranch sauce for dipping. My friend has gotten them before and raved about them, however I thought they were just OK. Tuesday also brings the taco specials for $2. Last night's taco choices were either chicken or beef (I believe it changes each week). I stuck with chicken, which I thought were really good. Once we passed happy hour, we went with the Tuesday specials of $2 Mexican beers (Corona, XX, Pacifico). There were also $4 tequila shots, but we weren't going down that road.  Overall, I thought we got away with a great value and had a great time (about $15 each before tip for 3 hours). Our server Alex was great and I would definitely go back again.

ueKCtcl7catmCxYu1geeJA.text: 3.5 rounded up to 4 I like this place. Food is good. Service is ok. atmosphere is ok.

C8mAT8yY8AS5klIQi_7y0A.text: Shady Grove is one of my favorite lunch spots in Pittsburgh. They have a great atmosphere compete with a full bar and televisions typically playing the sports games. Throughout the week they have great drink specials such has half off bottles of wine.  One of my favorite dishes is the buffalo chicken dip. Its not particularly spicy but it is great! Additionally, as a side the sweet potato tots are really good, especially with the sauce they come with.

_FzbC-xIrJ-WJDMXoqhuTg.text: Stopped while at UPMC. Only - was upstairs. Really good food. Very happy & nice waitress. Beer cold. Very comfortable, friendly, nice evening meal. Italian and more authentic.

tBDGGm4x4BZb21LUGF5sIA.text: Fun place to have some drinks! Didn't have any food because we were there late night. Awesome staff! The friendly bartender saved my iPhone because my drunk ass left it behind. Very much appreciated!!!

VzB6OkL8A59En1s2sUecOQ.text: Two words:  mango salsa.    That is my entire review.

MsHFHpT0RYqVKx07oL2hyA.text: This is my favorite place to eat in Shadyside because they have such delicious and HUGE salads.  They also have good Happy Hour deals (half price wine bottles on Fridays - heyy!)

5dnHwYOGqOgPke1RLLOuqg.text: Go here for lunch. The salads are fantastic (mine was topped with sweet potato tater tots, loads of grilled chicken and cheese. What's not to like?) The service, also fantastic and very quick. Atmosphere is a little grimy and you feel like you're eating at a bar.

Z6Pk6uwsjGGCOQuRCqlYhQ.text: I came here after an entire day of not eating, because I was traveling. I've never tasted better nachos in my entire life. I'm not sure if it was because I was so hungry, but I will stand by my statement saying that they are the best tasting nachos to grace my tastebuds. I also had a burger that was delicious. Can't remember what kind it was, but I was so full after gorging myself on nachos that I couldn't finish the large portions. As a poor college kid, Shady Grove is an awesome treat. I love it and can't wait to go back!

jBmGnDdAbuQwTQMWxOY3yA.text: This is a great casual place to grab a drink and some food with friends. It's not incredibly unique, but that's probably where the charm lies: comfort food. Wednesday wine nights are the most rowdy it gets here, with the doors open for customers to walk upstairs to Up Kitchen where they've set up a DJ. Half priced bottles- best if you arrive earlier than you think you should.

yRZwJs2gg0BXe3vVJm80Pw.text: Such a great place to eat before going out, or with a happy hour. The food is more elaborate than bar food, and you can get a really filling meal for pretty cheap. It was my favorite place to go when I was at school at Pitt. I absolutely love their sweet potato tater tots. There isn't much seating for parties of more than 4 but if youre willing to wait a little, they will usually make it work. They also have specials every night, and I don't think I ever spent more than $25, including an app, a drink and my meal.

ae-0UJ6Tn5Zik0g4xP6Pcg.text: The food is not good Weekends are very crowded So mediocre.

b9LhM_EUEYrCdtBEDRRD-w.text: This place is consistently good. In particular, their sandwiches (on ciabatta) are to die for. I honestly find myself craving the food here from time to time. I've never had a bad menu item but there are some staples I tend to order repeatedly. The chicken club is excellent and my favorite part is that the chicken is a whole piece of grilled chicken. The sweet potato tots also come with a spicy ranch dipping sauce that is to die for and worth ordering for itself. They also always have excellent drink specials that rotate on a daily basis. I wouldn't consider them anything in special but the prices are good and they always have a beer or wine I'm interested in drinking.  There are a few things that prevent me from giving this place five stars. The inside gets really noisy which is to be expected, it's a bar in a younger part of the city, but some tables are notably louder than others. The wait list is always long and putting your name in ahead of time on the app is really hit or miss. Sometimes it works and sometimes it doesn't. The service is also hit or miss. As I mentioned - it's a busy place, but the last time I went I ordered a second beer as our dinner came out and it didn't arrive until my friend and I had finished. We aren't quick eaters and we're really enjoying our time together so this was annoying but also at the same, I sat there and finished the beer without complaint. Another time I was here and we ordered our sandwiches and they came out in wraps and not ciabatta and when I said something, we were told the restaurant had run out of ciabatta. No biggie, it's just something I wish would have been communicated earlier to me.   I will continue to go back here. They have a great outdoor seating area I love to enjoy dinner on.

photos.caption: Photo of Shady Grove - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Chicken Club and sweet potato tots
Photo of Shady Grove - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Buffalo chicken sandwich

B8cPIslS9rgM1kwTcVui4g.text: Came here last night for dinner for the first time in years. We were seated immediately despite what appeared to be a decent crowd. They had $4 champagne glasses on special- SOLD.  We ordered the fried pickles as an appetizer. I ordered the summer salad as my entree and my daughter ordered the quesadilla off the kids menu. The fried pickles were A+. I was not a fan of the sauce but I was fine with eating the pickles plain. My salad was super good. They provided a generous amount of goat cheese which I did not complain about. I could have done without the dressing.  Will most likely be back when in the area shopping. Hopefully sooner than 10 years from now and hopefully on a champagne special night!

gGbl_mt-bVNWZn9zeT_ebA.text: After receiving several recommendations, I decided to give Shady Grove a shot. I went for lunch with my sister and we were sat outside in their upper deck, which was so nice and relaxing! We ordered the fried pickles to start - they're the chips not the spears if you're into it. They tasted great dipped in the Cajun ranch. Then I had the Shazam Shrimp Tacos. They're kind of messy to eat - but SO worth it. My sister just got the Loaded Latkes for her meal. I tried one and they were pretty good!  The only reason I am taking a star away is because none of the food was served super hot. Everything that was supposed to be hot (friend pickles, shrimp, latkes) was lukewarm.

photos.caption: Photo of Shady Grove - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Shazam Shrimp Tacos
Photo of Shady Grove - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Fried Pickles
Photo of Shady Grove - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Loaded Latkes

ukvj8dba9Y_cSkVlJLCpmQ.text: Shady Grove is a great place to go in Shadyside. It is a nice casual atmosphere and has a great selection of menu items. It is primarily American style food, but there are some unique items on the menu. I have had their Caprese sandwich and their guacamole burger. Both were really good! One of my favorite parts is that you have the option to get sweet potato tater tots as your side for an extra dollar, which is worth it to me!

photos.caption: Photo of Shady Grove - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Guacamole Burger with sweet potato tots

n_RI9Hyk8tVLrIcUozivWA.text: Per recommendations from multiple friends, I decided to stop in here the other day to sit outside, have a beer, and get some work done on my laptop. They have wi-fi which is a nice plus (just ask the hostess or your waitress for the password), and it's pretty high speed. I sat outside, had a beer, and ended up also ordering the summer shrimp salad.... it was to die for. Honestly one of my favorite salads I've ever had. Will absolutely be back to either eat in or get take out.   Other info - limited (2h max, I believe) parking is available on neighboring streets. Kind of amidst the residential Shadyside area. Outdoor and some upper deck seating, as well as regular inside tables and high tops in the bar area.

photos.caption: Photo of Shady Grove - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Summer Salad

Oej4l6e06AlJYBwxrEicgA.text: Shady Grove is a great place to stop for lunch or happy hour. They have specials every night of the week, including half off burgers on Monday, which is a great deal. My veggie friend and I recently discovered their vegetarian chicken wings -- she says she's been searching for good vegetarian chicken wings in Pittsburgh for months, and Shady Groves are the best she's had!

photos.caption: Photo of Shady Grove - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. A couple of apps for lunch: vegetarian chicken wings and bruschetta.

32E6ts0KcsXvjGHjjG1hbg.text: UPDATE: My friends and I were looking for a spot outside to enjoy some drinks after dinner one night and ended up here. We sat on the deck upstairs and ordered drinks and appetizers. Our table shared the buffalo chicken dip, Shady Sticks, and fries with cheese and bacon. Everything was so delicious! Our waitress, Dale, was seriously so great and took care of us the whole night! We loved having her as our waitress!

0vZoNAClVdPKzEHyBpOyUw.text: Upon walking in to SG you get that trendy restaurant with dive bar feeling. You know, the kinda dark, kinda smells like cleaner vibe?   We sat at the bar on a Saturday morning for brunch, I wasn't impressed with the service or the selection of food. They have a small menu, and not many options. None for vegans, and only one vegetarian option.   Food took some time to come out, and it was pretty good. I was a little bummed at how small my food was but it was pretty tasty. My friend got the chicken and waffles, and I must say that the sweet potato bites that came with it were very good.  I would come back to check out their bar another time, but wouldn't necessarily recommend this place for brunch.

photos.caption: Photo of Shady Grove - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Shady Grove - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

dSFuDbGj7n1N-IE89i6RWQ.text: A cool modern restaurant with great food. I came here with a group of friends on a Saturday around 4:30 and they were able to sit us immediately. A waitress came over right away and took our drink orders as we waited for the rest of our group. After about 10 minutes, the waitress came over and informed us the upstairs was rented out for a private party at 6pm and asked if we wanted to move so we could have more time to enjoy our time together. She happily put our name on the list for a table downstairs, which is smaller and tough for a group of 5. But within 20 minutes the waitress came back and led us down to our new table.   We ordered the artichoke dip, which was incredible! It was fresh and the ingredients balanced each other out perfectly so the flavor was blended, rather than the cheese overpowering. The artichoke was also chopped in small pieces so you didn't just get a chunk when you dipped the pita bread in the dish. The dish was large enough for our group to enjoy too.  For an entree, I ordered the Spicy Jerk Chicken Sandwich. I asked for the Spicy sauce on the side and I'm glad I did, it had quite the heat and I was glad I could apply it myself. The chicken could have been a little bit more tender, but it was still seasoned nicely. They put a large amount of guac on it too, which was great to help with the spicy level. The fries that came on the side were fantastic. They were super crispy and fresh. Also, the dish was large enough to save half my sandwhich as leftovers.

photos.caption: Photo of Shady Grove - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Spicy Jerk Chicken Sandwich
Photo of Shady Grove - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Artichoke Dip

0kHWZ77JGZHvRjE9xh1tUA.text: I've been here twice in one week and I'd be willing to go back again soon. This is probably one of my favorite places in the city.   The first visit was on a Monday when they were having trivia. I ended up getting the Waldorf Salad w/ Maple Cider Vinaigrette - I was going to get the Balsamic but the server suggested the Maple Cider since it was made in house. So happy she suggested it! That dressing was everything and the salad was one of the best things I've eaten. I tried a few of the sweet potato tots that my cousin ordered and they were super good too! Not as delicious as the fries though, because those are on another level.  Since we won trivia, we got a $30 gift card and decided to come back during the weekend. I started off with the Adult Capri Sun which was pretty good - tastes like some tropical drink you'd find at a Caribbean resort.  We ordered the buffalo chicken dip which we've had before (boyfriend loves it). If you like your buffalo with a lot of heat, this probably won't satisfy that craving. It's super creamy with the lightest hint of buffalo. For those that don't like heat, this will probably be a great option for you. They don't give you a ton of pita though so while it's good, I suggest getting the chips.   For my entree, I ordered the Korean Fried Chicken Sandwich. It was good, but once again, I like more heat and this was lacking. I didn't feel like it had a ton of flavor but the ingredients were fresh and good quality. It just needed something. Like I said earlier, the fries are so good. They're battered and what French Fry dreams are made of.   When I come back, I'm absolutely going with a salad. I think it's what they do best and I can't wait to eat it again.

photos.caption: Photo of Shady Grove - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Waldorf Salad with Maple Cider Vinaigrette
Photo of Shady Grove - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Adult Capri Sun
Photo of Shady Grove - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Buffalo chicken dip with pita

DLo3HkZKErk-KaGaavO3dQ.text: Shady Grove is always a good stop when in Shadyside. The food is excellent, the wait staff is fast and friendly, and the atmosphere is amazing. I typically like eating on the top floor for the ambient lighting. It's great for conversation and the food is quite nice. For a restaurant and bar, Shady Grove does well for itself. The fries are some of my favorite, and they have a diverse drink selection! I absolutely recommend this place for a night out!

photos.caption: Photo of Shady Grove - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

gufqhrqozbO3K8U_ORlr8A.text: I visited this place with my Wife, Daughter, and her boyfriend. He had frequented this establishment while in College and recommended it.  I had Pizza and Bier, my wife had sliders and Chicken Nachos, my daughter and her boyfriend had sandwiches and waffle fries.  We all loved the food.  The service was excellent as the young lady that served us was right on top of everything. The neighborhood is top notch too. I will definitely return many times.

q1kxYpfM2gZFt5WyKD77uQ.text: My friend and I made a quick stop here for a late lunch.  I've been here before and not disappointing. We sat at the bar since we were on time constraints. She has the autumn salad but added lightly seared ahi tuna to it- salad was great tuna was only ok. I had the BBQ chicken salad which really hit the spot- chicken was tasty the salad fixings were crisp and fresh. Not a disappointment.

photos.caption: Photo of Shady Grove - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Autumn salad w ahi tuna
Photo of Shady Grove - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. BBQ chicken salad
Photo of Shady Grove - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. App and salad menu

KrTuYHkmB8u5czroNL9yfQ.text: This is one of my new favorite places in Shadyside.  I have wanted to eat here for a long time and finally got the chance this past weekend.  I love the setup here with lots of indoor and outdoor seating.  Our server, Shidrokh was so nice and friendly.  She explained the best drink and food options for us.  For drinks my wife and I both tried the Adult Capri Suns.  I had the raspberry flavor and it was so good.  Great drink for a hot day.  My wife had the watermelon and liked hers as well.  On to the food.  Shady Grove has a lot of different options.  I wanted to try so many different things.  For an appetizer we had the buffalo chicken dip.  This was some of the best I have ever had.  While buffalo chicken dip is by no means a complicated dish, some places do it right and some places don't.  Theirs was a perfect amount of spice and sauce.  It also came with some really good grilled pitas.  For my meal I went with the Steak House Burger.  The burger was topped with sauteed spinach, bacon, onion straws, gouda cheese and a garlic aioli.  These toppings were very fresh and balanced out which made for a delicious flavor.  The beef itself was clearly fresh ground and had a great taste.  It was slightly over cooked for my medium rare request, however the burger was so juicy and flavorful it didn't really matter.  The burger came on a fresh brioche bun which held everything together.  The sandwiches and burgers come with waffle fries which were very crispy and had a great seasoning on them.  They also have some really good house made ranch which went perfect with the fries.  Can't wait to come back and try some of he other options on the menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Shady Grove - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Buffalo Chicken Dip
Photo of Shady Grove - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Steak House Burger
Photo of Shady Grove - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

O_0UiGF6sq9CEc1fm6b3tA.text: love this place! Definitely one of my favorites in shady side! foods always good! Servers are always happy and super nice and I really enjoy the menu. Nice variety!!

photos.caption: Photo of Shady Grove - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. drink menu. Decent amount to choose from

3PQXqdo1FbCPSCoBKFQWHw.text: Shady Grove is a great option when you have a lot of people to feed with differing tastes. Their menu is huge: pizzas, salads, sandwiches, appetizers. There's plenty to choose from. I always order the salads--particularly the southwest salad. It comes with tilapia which is always flaky and perfectly cooked. Don't switch the dressing - the one it comes with is a great paring. They don't skimp on the portion sizes either.  The pizzas are very good as well. The margarita pizza is the way to go, classic flavors. Or if you need an appetizer, try the shady sticks or guacamole deviled eggs.   The dishes aren't all perfection, though. Once I ordered the crab cake BLT. That dish was a bit disappointing: the crab cake was small and bland. I would have loved a flavorful sauce of some kind to amp it up.  So, some of the dishes are fantastic, while others may be lacking. That being said, I always enjoy my visits to Shady Grove.

gXRCEDVldYGgpfyNpq3T_Q.text: This is the third time I've been the Shady Grove and I have to say that I don't have many complaints! On this occasion, I was visiting my friend in Shady Side and we were looking for somewhere to grab lunch. We walked in to Shady Grove and were immediately seated. Our waitress brought us waters and asked us if we wanted anything else to drink. I ordered a mimosa and my friend ordered a Kettle One Shirley Temple. We decided to split two appetizers- buffalo chicken dip and Shady sticks- which were bought delightful. The buffalo chicken dip came with nacho chips and pita bread, which I thought was pretty cool. The Shady sticks were similar to breadsticks with cheese on top and marinara dipping sauce. Both of these appetizers were HUGE. We didn't finish either of them!   The only two problems I had were: 1. The only restroom is upstairs, which is annoying for the customers seated downstairs and 2. My mimosa was $9! It was a regular-size mimosa, with nothing special about it. I think $9 is a little much for a mimosa served in a champagne flute.

dZzIzbxe5h5zk1misHZqAQ.text: One of my favorite go to restaurants in Pittsburgh. So many selections and everything is good. The environment is usually upbeat. They have wine nights and it does get a bit crazier later at night then. My go to is anything buffalo chicken and their wrap is one of my favorite in town. Their buffalo chicken pizza is pretty great as well. I used to crave their waffle fries with the wrap, but sadly, upon visiting yesterday, they CHANGED THEIR WAFFLE FRIES. They resemble chick fil a waffle fries which are mediocre at best. Not seasoned, and not crisp enough. I will have to switch back to sweet potatoe tots. The service is usually quick and staff almost always friendly and accommodating. They have handful of craft beers on tap with $3-$5 happy hour drafts + various apps.   This has been any favorite Pittsburgh casual fare restaurant since I discovered it years ago.   Go, you shouldn't be disappointed. Unless you expected the old waffle fries.

E4o_0m0SW9RJyVsl64jiJw.text: I thought this place was really cute. I like the fact that they have a balcony and multiple floor seating. I got the loaded latkas which were mini latkas with guacamole, sour cream, and cheese on top. They were really tasty and just what I was craving for. Because these were fried, they were a little greasier than I would prefer but really that is the only complaint. I thought it was unique that they had this item on the menu and I would definitely come back again.

photos.caption: Photo of Shady Grove - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

T21vbNMiPDhVxod_-3Rlrw.text: Great atmosphere and great food! Sat outside on a nice day and had brunch here for the first time and really enjoyed it. It was one of those moments that makes you really enjoy Pittsburgh. Great food for great prices. Can't wait to go back!

BX2E_5psDW_VSLzgTgfTsQ.text: Went out to eat here with a friend the other night.  First thing, this place is extremely vegetarian friendly, but not in an overtly "I love growing my own vegetables and using vegetable oil to fuel my Prius" sort of way.  Still plenty of options for carnivores.    I ended up ordering nachos with mango salsa to start and a southwestern salad for the the main course.  The mango salsa was great, I just wish they served more seeing as the ratio of chips to salsa was kind of lop-sided.    The southwestern salad was fantastic.  With a healthy dose of black beans avocado and this tangy vinaigrette type dressing which definitely hit the spot, I became an instant fan.  I'm usually not the type to order salads, but my friend warned me in advance of the serving size, and she wasn't lying.  They literally serve these salads in deep stainless steel bowls.  The appearance is kind of raw, but my taste buds don't lie.    Overall our experience was good, though I wish the service was a bit more prompt.  Having to wait an eternity for the check was kind of painful.  Otherwise, I'd easily give this place 4 stars.  Regardless, I'll be back in the near future to check out some of the other offerings on the menu.

4quCr-HCq0ouRErhf3imbA.text: Great place for a variety of foods! Salads are huge and fresh, burgers are always super juicy and yummy, but the best thing on the menu is the sweet potato tots. Those things are literally in my dreams some nights!

7cs8qek3ZuC6nqy7QSyXow.text: The staff was really jerky. I had the French onion soup. It was incredibly salty. A friend had a burger that was pretty subpar, especially for over $10.

tyZic4doCD4IlDkntBPByA.text: Last weekend went to Shady Grove yet again. I visit my daughter in Shadyside quite frequently, and love this place - salads are delicious and had an amazing fried green tomato BLT.  In the past Ive had many of the selections and have never been disappointed.

05Z4RYQNCfr9pe2BE_16sg.text: I found it a bit annoying to have to show my ID just to go in and have dinner here...  The food however was good.  I ended up getting some kind of spicy chicken wrap and I was pleasantly surprised to taste that it was actually spicy!  I've been here before just for going out and it can be fun.  I would say most people there are in their 20s and 30s and it tends to be crowded on weekends.

enNsNj2Z74Gd-adOCFlagg.text: Half portion of nachos available during happy hours, and still a huge plate. Grabbed their daily special last time, was a blue cheese buffalo hot dog (forgot the name). Very satisfying. Not 21 yet but will definitely return for half price cocktails this summer after my birthday.

taczRZTKI4ic9bxlPVC9Fg.text: Excellent food and great staff! My girlfriend and I are becoming regulars here. The menu has a wide variety of items with plenty of healthy options available as well. The chicken pesto sandwich is fantastic! Give this place a try!

Z1q__TXnyoXdGUP9dGqBiw.text: Nothing Shady about the great service. Everyone was friendly and timely.  Great upscale bar food.  Servings are huge. Small pizza is something a family might share.  Great place.

hqXM_6WPebibfnsiWpW3mw.text: I'm not sure how this place gets as many stars as it does.  Located in a popular area, I guess.  The food is pretty bad.  If you're looking for a sandwich on somewhat stale bread, with that obvious beginning-to-wilt, straight from the bag lettuce taste/smell permeating the entire sandwich and soup that is just kinda warm... well then, this is your place.  We really should have sent all of our food back, and just said "sorry, but this is just bad food".

nCjkaBJ2pfZbYwSbCrIZEA.text: Big bar that seats around 20, and many tables inside,outside. Upstairs is more like a cocktail lounge and is closed off during the day. About 8 tvs inside. Dartboard upstairs as is the only one. It's a sports bar but is clean and the food is pretty good.

gPkI2JOl0KpmLMg9sJN65A.text: My go-to weekend place.  Yummy food, great drinks, chill atmosphere.  Every time a friend/family member visits me in Pittsburgh, this is where I take them!  Love the summer salad, waffle fries, and wraps!

63MMNkXL5orO1Scf9UBfVw.text: Oh Shady Grove you have improved! Or maybe it's the fact that I'm getting old and hit you up for the early bird special (compared to late night service). Either way the pizza is amazing (try the new shrimp option) and service was on point.

-_rPf-j0Fy2kP2LMCRWyBA.text: Really nothing special to this place except the outside seating they have in the summer.  Recently came here, and my friend ordered a Coors Light draught (wimp i know), but it tasted absolutely awful.  Don't know if it was the keg that was bad or the hoses that hook up to the keg that need to be cleaned.   Next I got a Turkey Rachel.  Probably one of the most flavorless sandwiches I've ever had.  The only thing I could really taste, was the rye bread it was on, which was quite good.  My friend got the veggie powerhouse salad.  He did seem to enjoy that.  I had a bite as well, and I will say, not bad.  Overall, service was super slow.  I don't think I'll be back for a meal anytime soon.  It's just too mediocre to waste your time, money, or calories here.

LFj4D2wPqLtMw3MYC_fCQw.text: loved it. started off with some sort of cucumber/basil drink.. a little strong on the cucumber, but pretty interesting. then my guests and i shared pretzel bites which were delish. i don't remember which burger i got to be honest, but i do remember thinking it was very good. the only strange thing about the place is the bathroom... it's upstairs and near impossible to find. i'd go back for sure, and would like to try several more dishes.

gEfxW2MucnBP6pjpjR3YTw.text: One of my favourite places in shady side, pittsburgh. It's perfect for a sunny day brunch as well as a gloomy wine night. Wednesday's they have half off on a bottle of wine and their DJ is phenomenal. The section upstairs turns into a lounge. Perfect way to end a crappy study week.

3pmdYhATvP2bGlYnlRaZdg.text: My wife and brother and wife went here again on Saturday after a long bike ride. Once again it didn't disappoint. We sat outside in the little roped off area next to the street. Our waitress was extremely nice and attentive. I ordered a vodka tonic and a side salad and we split the caprese pizza. This is a must try and one of my favorite pizzas. It has garlic, mozzarella, tomato, and basil. It's simple but delicious, It was cooked to perfection in their brick oven. The side salad was large and very tasty. What we like is Shady Grove always has some drink specials. Great food, service, and vibe. This is a must stop in Shadyside.

mzjOUCw4HXzOaCRT8W2c3A.text: Decent food, horrible service. We've tried this place 3 times, and it's been one snotty hostess/server after another. The managers could not seem to care less either. They also seem to get annoyed when you order or even ask about Happy Hour; don't have a HH if you don't want people to order from it! So many better options in the area with better menus and nicer employees.

ig-GgL2euOuzPktg8X8gMQ.text: To be honest I think I might just come back on weekends for drinks because they're food did not make me feel too great afterwards. It is normal bar food I suppose, but I was hoping for better quality. I ordered with my friend the pesto pizza and their new sandwich with spinach and chicken with aioli and cheese. I felt like i gained a few pounds, but the pizza was a little bland and the sandwich mainly just tasted like spinach. Their fries are crispy and taste pretty good along with their tater tots that I had on my first visit.

VZ1fpOy3TLrfbCLGr2fDmw.text: Typical bar food. Good burgers.   It gets extremely crowded on Wednesday evenings for half-price wine night. Be wary. If you're going for food on a Wed, show up by 6:30. Otherwise you'll never get a table.

qZtdLWNgd9hh8fNqqbYkUg.text: A pretty good place to stop in for bar food on Walnut Street. They gave good drink specials (1/2 bottles of wine Wednesdays and some Fridays) and the food is average. I'm not a huge fan of the crowd that stops in on a night out, but I would probably come back for dinner sometime.

ovQDpotGbvDaYHSeG5RyiQ.text: Stopped here for lunch. We had French Dip wrap which consisted of sliced ribeye cooked in just enough fat to make it tasty with a great flavored au jus. Tomato cheese soup which was quite good. Onion rings which seemed pretty ok Pulled pork on Kaiser Roll which was sweet sauced but not overly heavy which allowed the taste of the pork to shine through. Coffee which was very good and moderately dark.  All in all very good service and a great meal.

k3_hENirBnblY1AnwTe78g.text: They have a fashionable, attractive people social scene going on most weekend nights.  I believe Friday is usually their biggest night, last Fri, they had a great DJ spinning electronica and house mixed in with your typical top 40 crap at the upstairs bar which also has a small dance floor.  If you're into the best scene, good looking people, and some risk of phoniness.  Drink prices are reasonable given the crowd they're shooting for.

DXyFKYNJTAjPDW2GVRFgtQ.text: One of my favorite places to go over in Shadyside. They a lot of different sandwiches and friendly staff. The chicken funguy sandwich is my go to! You have to try this play at sometime in your life.

ljs5_wcoLI9XqiLxvg3SyQ.text: Stopped in again a few weekends ago on a Sunday evening during a Steeler game.  Service was MUCH better than the first time and our food was excellent. I got one of their million chicken wraps and Bobby got a shrimp wrap as well.  Their sweet potato tots and fries were to die for. This place is right up my alley - reasonably priced for delicious, large portions and a very extensive menu so you can pick whatever you may be in the mood for at that particular time.  Plus, they have good drink specials.

6Cg9snh7L-5T7bj-jjqM-Q.text: Service and drinks were great! We went on a Thursday night and sat at the bar downstairs. Fabulous drink specials and great bartenders!

nTVgh52C4IpneppxwvcX2g.text: I really like Shady Grove. It's simple, low cost and relaxed. There is even some outdoor seating to people watch Shadyside in the summertime.  My go to meal is their summer salad. Their salads are huge! You wouldn't leave hungry after their bed of lettuce with delicious toppings. I've had other things like sandwiches but always tend to gravitate toward their salads because they are so big and full of flavor. They also have fabulous happy hour specials to take advantage of if you care for a beverage. Wine Wednesday is always a hit! I never ever had an issue with service with my many times visiting. Always friendly and attentive. Always a go to for a simple meal when in the area. I'm telling you, get that summer salad. It's so good I crave it!

JhNzyJdqkzzbHgfl2g1F3A.text: Return? Not a destination spot but a good option if your in the area  Atmosphere (3) - Standard bar vibe. Very busy when we were there Food (3+) - french dip (3 - a little shy on roast beef, more bun), fries (4), Bloody Mary (4) Service (3) Friendly Cost = $58.24 after tax/before tip (included 2 other meals plus drinks)

--deHdgCO8w3xKvF8MjIkg.text: Dope food! Dope service! Dope times! Bee and Liz are excellent employees made the whole experience dope!!

ape3ezFlbWoRHkksRjd1hA.text: What a terrible takeout experience today! It took over 30 minutes to make one burger and the final product was not at all what I asked for (had sauce, toppings, etc when I asked for plain). Should have been such and easy order. I will never go back there.

WmA8-IpjRI4CN-3r6MuSdw.text: I normally don't order the same thing every time I go to a restaurant, but Shady Grove is the exception. The Autumn salad is delicious-- the toppings are plentiful and definitely make the salad memorable (unlike a lot of restaurants). There is a plethora of fantastic appetizers on the menu; in fact, the buffalo chicken dip is the only food that makes me occasionally regret going vegetarian (sorry, not sorry). My food has always been fresh and delicious here!   The wait normally isn't that bad, but my only complaint is how FREEZING cold it is in the "waiting area". There isn't very much that they can do about this, unfortunately.

xIHm4FzmPYFUlMFUb-UhHg.text: Went to ShadyGrove on Friday night for a quick bite to eat.  The food is just okay.  Well cooked but not really seasoned, so they should probably leave salt and pepper on every table as a standard.  I got the sweet potato tater tots.  The spicy ranch sauce that's served with it is pretty food, but the tots themselves have a weird texture.  Their waffle fries however are a winner.  My best suggestion is to go here for the ambience but not so much the food.

bv_KCWQpObog0XKb3DsevQ.text: How have I not reviewed Shady Grove yet!?  I have been here so many times, I could not even begin to guess a number. Shady Grove is one of those places that is reliably good--I can't think of anything that I have ever ordered here that I did not like. The menu is large and features a variety of sandwiches (also available as wraps), burgers, pizzas, and HUGE salads. Being a fan of spicy food, some of my personal favorites are the buffalo chicken pizza (self-explanatory) and the Fiero Chicken sandwich (grilled chicken breast, pepper jack cheese, guac, lettuce, tomato, and a spicy habenero sauce). They also have these great crispy french fries which come with the sandwiches.   They do half-priced bottles of wine on Wednesday nights. I've had both good and bad experiences--it can get REALLY crowded, so if you don't get there early enough you won't get a table. It's kind of awkward when someone in your party has to then carry the wine bottle around.  Bonus points for outdoor seating! Always a good time.

KnoXTrypmy-n5-E5Z3CF-A.text: This was a great place to get together with friends. Wouldn't recommend for a first date because it's pretty loud in there. The food was really good. I got the strawberry chicken salad and it was huge, I couldn't finish it all! My friend got the Diablo burger and it came with this really great spicy sauce that balanced the burger out. There was a lot on the menu, so I would definitely come back to try something else.   I came on a wednesday night, so I had to wait about 15-20 minutes for a table, but there's an open bar on the second floor so it wasn't too bad. Wednesdays were half off wine bottles which was probably why it was busy!

3gA3DLcQ1NaPrzsnC03k5Q.text: Food: 6/6 As far as selection goes, this place has it all. Honestly, the menu is huge, featuring salads, pizzas, and sandwiches galore. The food itself though, is delicious. I recommend the Shady Steak Sandwich, which features steak, peppers, potato latkes, a fried egg, and garlic aioli. It is banging. The salads are extremely large, their french fries are particularly amazing, and the pizzas are great too. Overall, probably my favorite food in Shadyside. Service: 3.5/6 I'm gonna be frank, the service is pretty okay. Atmosphere: 4/6 It's a decent looking place, but nothing overly special. The music can sometimes be a little strange, or loud, but overall it is always enjoyable to eat here. Affordability: 4/6 It's not overly cheap, but it's not gonna break your bank. Pretty standard prices for what you're getting, though you do get a lot of food, which is a plus. X-Factor: 3/6 Nothing extremely special about Shady Grove, besides the Shady Steak Sandwich

QixYRtQvSCjYulfGGORspg.text: Food was okay. Typical American grill food done safe so dont come here expecting too much. Its better to think of food at this place as secondary to the drinks.  This place is a good meet up spot for drinks. You'll get a cool and casual feel here thats perfect on the weekends when you want to chill out with some friends.   This place does get a little busy so dont expect to come with a big group and get a table immediately. There's half off bottles of wine on Wednesday which is awesome

9MEr2ABif_5D_UczStSO2A.text: I often eat at this restaurant, mostly for convenience but also for price. I keep coming back because the drink prices are reasonable,  food is tasty, and the ambience is relaxed.   The food menu is a bit large which can be somewhat cumbersome. Although they offer a lot to choose from, impressively, most of what they offer is quite delicious. Some personal favorites are the Cobb salad and fried green tomatoes. Ticket time seems very efficient for kitchens size.   They don't offer too much space but do have outdoor seating for the warmer months. There's also additional seating upstairs. Seems to be a great spot for couples and small groups. The service is okay, at times not as quick as I'd prefer. Often feels like I have to coax somebody for attention instead of them anticipating my needs or checking back.   There are many sites to choose from in Shadyside but I'd grab a seat here if you want fresh, unique food pairings that won't break the bank.

U_S0JbSj7WfvTVlcoDhRaw.text: Shady Grove has been a great place for me and my co-workers to come enjoy a working lunch or a bottle of half-priced wine. Today I ordered a salad to-go and it was bountiful and delicious! The Waldorf Salad is so satisfying with juicy bites chicken, big walnuts, and granny smith apples. Definitely recommended for lunch, take-out or relaxing after a long day.

QHhqMFmHVm3-ZXU2xeP3Pw.text: Went here for dinner with my sister 2 weekends ago and it absolutely hit the spot! The menu has so many incredible options I could not decide, but finally went with the Chicken Florentine Sandwich and it was absolutely perfect! I opted for the sweet potato tots which were very good but maybe not as great as the hype led them to be. Still the service was excellent and my sandwich tasted as great as it sounded and was a terrific portion.

SOOajPNuzFbuvpiWXVkUJg.text: I rarely give restaurants a single star rating, and the thing is the food here is okay.  What i did not enjoy was being seated directly next to an outdoor dumpster, complete with garbage smell and flies everywhere.  Avoid the outdoor seating, bc just about EVERYTIME we go there, we get stuck sitting next ot the damn trash can.    The hostesses always try to seat that table bc no one wants to sit there.  Its fucking disgusting.  We asked to be moved and the hostess was crappy about it and said that all the seats inside were full and that we would have to wait.  the last time we sat outside, our waitress took our drink order and then no one came out for like, 30 min.  then the waitress told us she forgot she was our waitress.  the trick is to eat inside, at the bar.  or avoid this place completely.  why the hell they cant move the dumpster is beyond me, but i get grossed out just thinking about it.

sGgXJ2zTt6HwvCXBUFuEhA.text: Wasn't impressed.  Bar was too loud and too crowded.  Wings were ok wings but not special.   I'm sure this appeals to the 20 sth crowd, but I'm not 20 sth anymore. :)

3ErK7a-bbCgiyIW9k8o0Ww.text: If you want spit in your salad dressing youve ordered from the right place. Bummer I was a fan of them until this meal.

RVzJAUytczLVsCFh3vs4uA.text: Ambiance: Modern american bar and grill with a relaxed but somewhat more upscale vibe than your typical neighborhood sports bar.  Downstairs they have a large bar, and a decent number of tables wrapped around the bar area.  They do have plenty of TVs for watching the game, but this isn't really the type of place most people come to watch the tube.  There is an upstairs which is open on busier days and has both seating and its own bar.  The upstairs turns into more of a lounge after 10pm when food service stops including DJs mixing up the beats on some nights.  They also have outdoor sidewalk seating.  Drinks: They have a decent selection of beers including many craft options.  The wine list is fairly long but would leave a oenophile longing for more/better.  I've tried a few of their cocktails, which were good, but I would not describe this place as a cocktail bar.  Food: Shady Grove serves a wide variety of upscale bar food including burgers, pizzas, sandwiches, salads, and some good apps.  I've had the pizza a few times and am I fan of the buffalo chicken pizza.  The burger's are pretty good and are on special on Monday nights for 5 bucks I think.  Last night I had the shishito peppers and ahi tuna salad.  Both were very good.  Service: The service here can be variable.  We've usually had pretty good service but some nights they can get quite busy and then service has lagged, but this is the exception rather than the norm.  Overall: One of my favorite places to meet up with friends for food/drinks in Shadyside.  Tip: Wednesday is a very popular night with the Shadyside Yuppie crowd as it is half off wine bottles night (as is Friday night also).  They used to use the No Wait app but currently don't, nor do they take reservations meaning on busy nights you will need to wait for a table.

jHIjOz9TFcT0N-a6zoAvWA.text: Reasonable place for a drink and a bite to eat in the Walnut St. neighborhood. Outdoor seating is available when the weather allows. Beer menu is a bit limited but all in all, not much to complain or crow about.

KJF2cQXNsa8i4lB4IC0AIQ.text: Been here quite a few times for lunch and dinner and never had a bad experience. Food is good, menu has a wide variety of choices, there's outdoor seating, and the prices are reasonable especially considering the amount of food you get.   I've ever only gotten a beer with dinner so I can't really speak for the bar scene or what it's like after 9pm. Would recommend for lunch or dinner though.

xfJZyvZ1K9K5KEFRrhF0ag.text: Amazing food, amazing atmosphere. Pittsburgh salad is awesome! Wine night is amazing!

j6C-u0GeiSPJWbAQwtKMvA.text: Service upstairs is horrible. My husband and I have been up there three times with the same server and we have nothing good to say except the food is decent, but only when they put your order in properly. Twice we've been there and explicitly stated we're vegan and our food has come out with cheese after asking for our food without. Also, our server was eating dinner at the bar in front of guests while our drinks were sitting empty for twenty minutes. From now on, we will only go to drink when already intoxicated...

IE96Af1GWmg1vrlWrpSvpQ.text: Wasn't impressed this time around...   The mahi tacos were ok, but lacked any type of seasoning on the fish. The Bellini (that is supposed to be one of their popular drinks) wasn't good to me at all. Reminded me of sickening sweet cough syrup...  The service was good, we were always taken care of. Maybe I'll try something else on the menu since the atmosphere is usually very inviting.

Photo of Shady Grove - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Bellini

xAWcFeHGTMATCofsxYCOHA.text: Man, I've been going to Shady Grove since 2008, and it's a place with many of my fond memories. That being said, it's also been a place where I've had some of my worst memories too. Perhaps due to being in college and learning how to frequent bars for the first time. Yikes.   Beer specials are pretty good here, and wine night back in the day was a pretty big hit. I remember that they would close off Walnut Grill at night, which I thought was strange. They should have all the space available, because it can get super crowded here. The food here is pretty decent. A little more on the expensive side for Pittsburgh, but who am I to complain? The pizzas are all pretty good and the sandwiches are nothing to sniff at.   Service is pretty spotty, both at the bar and the tables. Bartenders are not generally attentive and the waitstaff is usually short-staffed, so it takes awhile for you to get things like water or other small requests. Also, they're not very friendly, which is disappointing. But, it's never really been enough to ruin anything. Overall, Shady Grove is a decent bar/restaurant with subpar service. If you're looking for a low-key drink or meal during the week, Shady Grove is a solid place for just that.

P5wPc0mmaKJpPyLBp0yDDg.text: The restaurant was fairly good. The menu is extensive. The food is delightful. The wine list is also impressive. The ambience really makes this place memorable. Whether you want to watch a sporting event or simply enjoy a nice, semi-casual night out--Shady Grove is your spot. The feel is young, contemporary professional rather than rowdy bar or stuffy lounge. If you want to unwind and have a decent time on a weeknight or weekend, this is the place to be; however, it may be too loud for some to enjoy.

17fzPcytN6DPwIdALf_d-g.text: Went here for a friends birthday. It was pretty good and we waited 20 minutes to get a seat, and then like 20-30 mins to get our food. I would recommend trying out some of their deals, like half off burgers some days.

GYJA--uLE0UBD2Nnjx5R_w.text: We headed out for a walk yesterday with all intentions on making dinner at home. Normally when Bobby & I go on a walk, it's been on Centre Ave so we lately we've been switching it up and going on Walnut St. I always check livingpittsburgh.com for deals around the city and found out that Monday night is burger night at Shady Grove- half price burgers. It wasn't particularly busy, but i soon realized we JUST missed some burger festival right outside which was seeing who had the best burger in the area, so everyone must have ate while there. Anyways, their menu seemed really great. I loved their pizza menu and we may have to stop in to try one of those. The entire menu seemed tasty (esp the sweet potato tator tots) I decided on the Shady burger which was a large burger topped with american cheese, bacon, egg & usual toppings- lettuce, tomato, onion & pickle. It comes with a side of fries, but you can upgrade to waffle fries or tots for $1. As delicious as the tots sounded, i loooove waffle fries so that was my choice. My burger was tasty and piled high. I would have gave them 4 stars if the service was a tad better. Our server was a sweetie but everything took foreverrrrr- being greeted, our drinks after ordering, the food (which most likely wasn't her fault) It was just annoying waiting around to be waited on and for the drinks when as i mentioned earlier it wasn't overly busy. Also, after getting my food, my drink was empty the entire time. She walked by and looked right at it but never brought another one. Overall, we may stop back but will most likely sit at the bar.

oEE8plMXsf7ilrU7_SrnHQ.text: Really cool place. Both upstairs and downstairs have a full bar. Wine is half priced bottles on Fridays and they have other specials every night of the week. The menu was big with a lot of unique appetizers and probably the biggest salad selection I've seen lately. I also liked how almost all of the sandwiches could be served on brioche or a wrap. My friend got the chicken florentine on brioche with  fries and I had the FGBLT (fried green tomatoes) with sweet potato tots. Everything was delicious and the sandwiches are big so we only ate half and took the rest to go. We shared our fries and tots and agreed that the fries were good but the tots were SO good you could tell they were homemade. They were almost more circular shaped than normal tots and they came with some sort of zesty ranch type dipping sauce that went perfect. The ambiance was dark and cool for a date night or girls night out like we did! I'd definitely go back.

6EPIvV8c4eRKYs64W-GVPQ.text: We had to wait for our iPhone to be fixed so we walked around the corner and found this little gemwe had dinner plans so my daughter and I decided to share   A pesto chicken wrap with onion rings.  First bite is just simply WOW .. Flavor bursting everywhere.. Seriously the best wrap I have ever had.. And the onion ring amazing. 5 stars without any hesitation. Great service and amazing food. Thank you

TUs7SU093ZMrMofBGie7Xg.text: Jerk wings were fabulous!  Also had the strawberry, goat cheese and chicken salad... Also excellent!  Served in a stainless steel mixing bowl. HUGE! Definitely recommend!

AwpS5izfLVoxy_y4idjQKA.text: Tasty. Not out of this world, but always satisfying! Would recommend their pizzas to anyone though. Such a good dough!

84OTYQ_j1l2St49FdasRiA.text: This is my favorite place to eat in Shadyside! Great specials and the staff are always nice! The menu has a great mix of simple and funky items so that everyone is happy! I adore their pizza but I've had their appetizers, wraps, burgers, and salads and enjoyed every item I've ever ordered! They serve some of the freshest salads in the city and I seriously couldn't rave more about that pizza! Definitely get the Bloomfield pizza and their bleu cheese dressing!

W6QQtLQOXOTVSk2O7-GAcg.text: Sometimes I love this place, sometimes I cannot stand it. It depends on how busy they are and who is working. One time I had one of the best waitresses I've ever had. Another time I had a waitress I'm pretty sure was coked up. Meh. You never know.  The food, however, is always decent bar food. I really the shady sticks and the "pretzel." I like the appetizers in general. I love their bloody marys. Good burgers. Large salads. Lots of add-on options for any sandwich, salad, burger, etc.  Over-priced cocktails, but decent specials. Good beer choice usually. All in all, it's a decent place. I take friends here who are visiting from elsewhere because it's close to my apartment and had something to offer everyone.

gg-GHYJ8cGLZC7kwdVfO5A.text: So I've been wanting to go here for a long time after hearing multiple friends tell me that it's a fun place to grab a bite to eat. Last evening my friends and the mother of one of the girls I was with were in the neighborhood, so we decided to stop in and see if they were still serving food.   There was a sign out that said "please seat yourself" and two gentleman manning the door. Given the two men monitoring the door and the late hour we imagined the kitchen might be closed and that it was drinks only (although people were inside eating, so we were on a he fence). So we asked the one guy if we would need IDs to get in (we are only 20 yrs old), and he said yes. That was fine, no problem, we would leave since we are not yet 21.  We turned around to leave and the guy hollered, "haha yeah, go back to your little house party, ladies," at us in a very rude and snarky tone.   We were all appalled by this employee's uncalled for outcry, but decided to ignore the jab. However, his condescending attitude is enough for me to never want to go back and try to eat there again. While I cannot say anything about the food, I had a terrible first impression of Shitty Grove and I hope that the rest of the staff is kinder than that young grump.

Bg4IKqt9kDNVQ9r8DiZJ3Q.text: Greg the bartender is the best!! If you stop In make sure you look for him!! And the food is always amazing. It always hits the spot
